boardgamecompilation: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
140135.description:
Small World's Designer Edition is a spare-no-expense version of Small World the board game; this version of the game is true to Philippe Keyaerts' original wooden prototype.

The Designer Edition will feature:
- 307 deluxe wooden tokens covering all races from the base game and its Cursed!, Grand Dames and Be Not Afraid expansions + the Lost Tribes
- each race comes in its own individual, lavishly illustrated box
- the banners, special powers and markers that complement the deluxe tokens will all be heat-printed on wood, matching the tokens neatly
- the victory coins will all be distinctive metal coins specially forged for Small World
- the maps will be super-sized copies of Small World's 2-5 player maps, and include a new 6 player map specially designed by Philippe Keyaerts
- the Dragon, the Catapult, the 2 Heroes will all be represented by custom resin miniatures
- the new "Pocket Encyclopedia" from the Kickstarter campaign

The copy purchased by Kickstarter backers will also include a deluxe wooden version of the 3 new Races & Special Powers in the Kickstarter Backers Bonus Pack as well as an engraved plaque.

The Designer Edition is a true collector's edition. There was a single production run made, with only a limited number of copies for the retail channel.
140135.name: Small World Designer Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 73 - If You Like Pandemic, Try...

140136.name: Sovereign: A Deck-Building Game
140136.description:
Sovereign is a relatively simple deck-building war game with a great deal of player interaction. Each player takes on the role of a leader, hidden behind his castle walls. The goal is to amass an army and batter down your opponent's walls.

All cards have two possible uses, most of which can either be a Simple Action, which is played then discarded, or a Unit, which remains in play until it is defeated in battle. Players generate gold to purchase more Contract cards and Influence to place their Units on the table.

There are two main paths to victory: one may defeat his opponent on the field of battle, or create a great Monument. Monuments are built in three tiers, each giving a permanent bonus (depending on the Monument). The third tier ends the game in a victory.

140137.name: Die Hard Arcade
140137.description:
User Summary

The President's daughter has been kidnapped and it is up to John McClane and a police companion to punch, kick, shoot, and blow their way through a horde of bad guys to save her. The game utilizes Sega's Virtua Fighter engine, but allows you to also make use of various weapons that you pick up along the way.

In Japan, the game is called Dynamite Deka.

Since Sega had a "Die Hard" license when they made this game, it bore the name and featured John McClane. When they designed the sequel, they lost the license, had to remove John McClane, and rename the game Dynamite Cop.

140138.name: Pirates in a bag
140138.description:
Pirates in Pocket is a fan-made PNP card games for free. Up to four players can compete for the King of Pirates on high seas.

Each player may send his/her ship to plunder ports & merchant ships, or attack other player's hideout. You may also send the captain or first mate to ports to do some secret missions like recruiting crews, gambling, collecting rumors & treasure hunting...No one knows what you have sent (ship or crew?)to each place until they are revealed. So it's critical to guess where your opponent's ship is going.

There are events in different places each turn. You may collect rumors in taverns to get hints about the coming events but not all rumors are correct.

You may use loots to hire more crews, bid parts to upgrade your ship, bribe guards, gamble, or even buy fames. Beware, as your fame go higher & higher, there is a big chance that you will be hunted by the Royal Navy or challenged by the notorous Ghost Pirate.

There are three kinds of combats in this game : Ship to ship combat, melee combat & duels between captains. Each captain has his/her own special ability which may get bonus in certain combat.

140140.name: Xmas Trivia
140140.description:
The publisher released several packs of cards in their Top Hat Trivia series.

Each version has cards with six questions on each one. The form of the questions is that 3 possible answers are read out so even the youngest family member can have a blind guess with a 33% chance of success.

The starting player takes a card and rolls the die. The result indicates which question to be asked. He asks the question to the player on his left. If the correct answer is given, the answering player takes the card and now it is his turn to ask a question to the player on his left, and so on. If a question should be answered incorrectly, the player who gave the wrong answer takes the card, rolls the die and asks the player to his left a question. (which could be the same one of course).

The winner is the first player to secure four cards.

140141.name: Monopoly: Danmark
140141.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the country Denmark

140142.name: Mephisto (Issue 55 - Nov/Dec 2012)
140142.description:
User Summary

Mephisto #55 provides gaming material for several RPGs (see the links). It also contains interviews with author Torsten Fink and illustrator Flavio Bolla, introduces the Hyddenworld series by author William Horwood, and offers a new Arkham Horror playset.
Several video games, board games, novels and comic books are reviewed, too.

140143.description:
Under Construction: Poland

We are currently observing the largest construction boom in Poland since the reconstruction after World War 2. These days not storks but steel cranes are characteristic features of Polish landscape. Building and structures are being erected everywhere. New ribbons of asphalt cut through the fields. Sleek spans of slender bridges join river banks. Ring roads encircle towns and cities. Multi-level junctions resemble gigantic works of abstract art. Polish engineers use state-of-the-art technology and heavy construction equipment. Local communities wholeheartedly support the development of transport infrastructure. An architect, a landscaper, a construction mech operator have become dream professions for a child and ideal occupations of a prospective son-in-law.
Welcome to Poland! Soon, 100 years after Eugeniusz Kwiatkowski and Tadeusz Wenda the country on the Vistula will need you for the national construction effort.

Under construction: Poland is a family board game, which with the subtle touch of irony and strong sensce of humor treats of building roads and highways in Poland. Players become managers, their goal is to finish all the contracted jobs faster than the opponents. Engineers, workers and dozens of very special machines are ready to start.

During their turn players decide either they work in the office or on the building site.
In the office players draw cards from the market and use special cards such as: Recruiter, Archaeologist, Supplier or Site Manager. Those cards make the game easier for the player, but harder for the opponents.
On the building site players bulid infrastructure by discarding relevant cards and placing tokens on the map. They can also get rid of Arachaelogist or use special cards: Local Community or Employee of the Month.
After finishing one of assigned contracts player gets 3 extra cards from the market.
Whoever complete all of his/her contracts first is the winner of the game.
The players have different number of contracts and infrastructures to be build, but the game is very well balanced.

The biggest advantages of the game are illustrations and high quality of materials used for its production. The board consists of 16 elements, shaped with great likeness to the polish voivodships. The network of roads and highway reflects ambitious plans of national infrastructure. Last but not least, few dozens of tokens and over 150 beautifully painted cards makes this game a “must have”.
140143.name: Polska w budowie

140144.name: Mind Benders
140144.description:
Simple quiz game but does have the virtue of an interesting array of question styles.

There are 90 cards and each one will be in one out of six types;

Code Crackers - Work out the secret code.
Cryptic Clues - As in a cryptic crossword.
Anagrams - Unravel to reveal the correct word.
Extreme Close-Ups - Guess the onject from an unusual angle.
Sudoku - Solve the number puzzle.
Logic Words - Guess word from an array of letters

The answers are on the back of the cards. You or your team get 1 point for every correct answer. The most points after a pre-agreed time has expired. wins.

140145.name: Monopoly: Liège
140145.description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium city Liège (aka Luik/Lüttich).

140146.name: Monopoly: Beaujolais
140146.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the wine region Beaujolais, in France.

140147.name: Monopoly: Namur
140147.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Namur (aka Namen), a city in Belgium

140148.name: Monopoly: Drouais
140148.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Drouais, a city in France

140149.description:
The Order of the Crimson Hand has infiltrated every level of society and performs cult rituals, binding dark creatures from another world to do their bidding! The stakes have never been higher, and the heroes must keep their wits about them if they are to prevent the rise of the Crimson Hand.

Fortune and Glory: Rise of the Crimson Hand is packed with new material for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game with new cards for every deck; new dangers to face – including a new game mechanism for "deadly" tests; new villains to fight, each with a highly detailed figure; epic city events, unique to each major city, that can be triggered; devious Crimson Hand Acolyte figures that are dispatched to race the heroes for artifacts; and a powerful new vile organization to contend with!

Components


1 Full-Color Rulebook
8 Crimson Hand Acolyte Figures
3 Unique Villain Figures
1 Vile Organization record Sheet
1 Tactics/Outpost Chart
1 Major City Epic Event Chart
1 Die-Cut Counter Sheet
79 new cards:
15 Dangers
3 Common Items
5 Gear
5 Allies
10 Enemies
5 Nazi Enemies
12 Events
5 City
3 Artifact
3 Adventure
3 Villains
4 Villain Events
1 Enemy Reference Card
15 revised Adventure Cards
140149.name: Fortune and Glory: Rise of the Crimson Hand
boardgameexpansion: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 57 : A Cure for the Future

140150.description:
Fortune and Glory: Treasure Hunters, the second expansion for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game, adds tons of new cards, a new personal mission deck giving heroes extra bonus objectives, two new villains to fight, and four new heroes to play, including Grant Jackson, a rough and tumble soldier of fortune, Nigel Harrington, the big game hunter, and Angel Espinoza, the daring mechanic who's ready to make her mark on the world! Adventure awaits as these new treasure hunters set out to find fortune and glory!

Components


1 Full-Color Rulebook
4 Unique Hero Figures
2 Unique Villain Figures
4 Large Hero Character Sheets
1 Die-Cut Counter Sheet
70 new cards:
20 Personal Missions
15 Dangers
3 Common Items
4 Gear
4 Allies
2 Enemies
10 Events
3 City
3 Artifacts
3 Adventures
2 Villains
1 Villain Event
140150.name: Fortune and Glory: Treasure Hunters Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game

140151.name: Monopoly: Maroc
140151.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Morocco, a country in Africa.

140152.name: Space Barbarian
140152.description:
Operational level wargame based on Japanese anime series Space Battleship Yamato 2199. The game covering war between Empire of Gamilas and Comet Empire.

Players control star fleet of either the Empire of Gamilas or Comet Empire.
The main engine based on Red Dragon Rising: The Coming War With China. Players manage movement, combat and call for reinforcements to home star.

Winner determined by victory points based on control of star zones or several three death conditions.

140153.description:
With the same mechanic as traditional TEG a new challenge in playing cards to conquer the planet

If you already know traditional TEG, you'll enjoy this thrilling adventure between 40 countries. The First player that achieves their secret goal or common goal will emerge victorious!

In this game you shuffle all the country card and give it evenly to all the players. Then give a secrect objetive, wich consist in having determined countries.

You must attack other players countries to conquer them and try to complete your objetive before other do!

also, if in your turn at least you conquer 1 country you can draw a special card wich can help you to get close to the objetive or complicate your rival's objetives

The great element of chance in T.E.G.. They're now replaced with dice cards, which each have 3 numbers in decreasing order. They're evidently an important part of the game: of the 137 cards, 56 are dice cards.

The combat between two players happens comparing two dice cards that players select from their hands. The one being attacked can even choose to grab the first dice card from a deck facing down, to leave the result completely to chance. The concept, again, is the same as the original: chance, with a certain degree of player control.
140153.name: T.E.G. Cartas

140154.name: Wilderness Hexplore Revised
140154.description:
From the introduction:
These tables describe how to run an improvised wilderness hex crawl. The idea is that the even the GM does not know what the players will encounter, since the map, features, and encounters are all rolled randomly at the table.

from the Notes:
This is a document created in support of my gaming group, and is not intended for sale. It is definitely a work in progress, and so use at your own risk. The philosophy of randomized tables like these, is that the GM is also playing a game, one that requires skill and creativity. Creating a narrative out of random results on the fly is what separates the good from the great. But as always, if the dice and tables result in something that is too boring or too brutal for your players, then use your power & creativity as the GM keep things fun.

140155.name: Espionaje Cartas
140155.description:
Espionage cards it's a dynamic and very fun game. Using your brain you have to discover the three variables of the confidential file, you have a lot of tools to your disposition. Use your private agenda...and you'll be the winner

The game is simple:
Every player recibes a deck of 15 black cards called "personal agenda"

Then you take the deck called "Confidential file" with 15 yellow cards and split it in 3 parts : 5 cards of locations (London, Athens, Paris, Tokyo and Panama), 5 cards of Spies (Orange Spy, Blue spy, Red spy, Green spy and White Spy) and 5 cards of devices (Jetpack, Airplane, Lethal Gas,Satellite and Helicopter). Shuffle every deck and take , without looking, 1 card per deck and face it down in the middle of the table. then merge the remaining cards into one deck, shuffle and deal evenly among the players.

Now its time to play!:
The objetive of the game is to discover the face down cards using logic and deduction.
First of all you know that the "confidential file" cards can't be in the center of the table so you discard those card from the "personal agenda" deck in your hand.

Now a player begins its turn by asking other players about some of their cards. For example: I ask to the player on my left for "the BLUE SPY in LONDON", or "In AIRPLANE to PANAMA". Every question must involve 2 elements of the 3 different variables (cities, spies and devices) it may include 2 of the same element, for example 2 agents, 2 cities or 2 devices.
Once the question was askes, the other player checks his/her cards of "confidential archive" and if he/she has 1 or two of those cards, he must show 1 to the player who asked. By knowing the card, you can discard what he/she shown from the personal agenda. otherwise he says "I'll pass" and another player must be asked.

The game continues like this until someone thinks that they know the cards facing down and makes and acussation! if he guesses right he wins if not the player to the left makes and acussation and so until someone wins!

140156.description:
A set collection and negotiation game centered around the early days of the Erie Canal. Players move along the canal collecting cards depicting the various cities along the waterway. Players use a rondel to move, draw cards, and trade cards with other players. Specific numbers of City cards are then traded in to allow placement of a warehouses in one of the two good types depicted on a specific city.

A fluctuating economic chart, based on the number of total goods on the board, determines the current price of a warehouse in each good. The player with the most total value in goods at the end of the game wins.
140156.name: Erie

140157.name: Imazine (Issue 23 - Summer 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Once Upon a Time in China
140157.description:
This issue (13 pages):

REVIEWS
Chinese Rolegames
PRO? NO!
Why amateurism is a Good Thing
ONCE UPON A TIME IN CHINA
The Water Margin Systems
COLLOQUY
Letters to the Editor

140158.name: Firearms! DX
140158.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to Firearms DX, a fan-created sourcebook on firearms for Tri-stat DX. This book was made specifically for modern day weapons in mind, but I have listed generic primitive and space-age weapons at the end. The book will list handguns, revolvers, assault rifles, hunting and sporting rifles, and sniper rifles, along with some of the heavier weapons, like a (barely!) man-portable gatling gun and the flamethrower. This totals over a 100+ weapons! It will even include various ‘oddities’ like a .38 cal cigar or the Stick Foam Sprayer. Because of the nature of this book, I must confess that I am not a vary knowledgeable when it comes to firearms. While writing this I tried to be as accurate as possible for each weapon detailed in this book. This doesn’t mean that what is found within Firearms! DX is 100% accurate and shouldn’t be used as a reference when dealing with real firearms, there are many books on the subject that provide a lot more useful.

140159.name: Master Esportes
140159.description:
A sports trivia game with questions involving many sportive themes, like, Soccer World Cups, Olympic Games and etc. The game mechanism includes a little arena where the game pieces are throwed by the players.
The players impulse the game pieces in the "arena" and the final position of those pieces determine what theme question has to be answered.
The arena has 3 tipes of holes, like a pool table, the kind of role (by proximity) determines a kind of question (True or false, direct answer, or multiple choice question).
So, the colored pieces determines theme and the hole determines a kind of question to be answered by the players.

140160.name: Young Turks at the Café
140160.description:
Author's description:

Young Turks is a serious roleplaying game for 3-6 players. It eschews the notion of a conventional GM in favor of a distributed resolution and scene-setting mechanic. It is
meant to be played in a single session of 3 to 4 hours. It uses the focal lens of a regular discussion group or society meeting to frame a large question about our society, moral values, or ethical assumptions and expectations, and challenges the characters to reconcile their beliefs with their experience.

140161.name: Super Master
140161.description: A general trivia game, based on the brazilian Grow's ultrasucceces Master. This game has 12.000 questions about 24 diferent themes and areas. The objective is move throght the board colecting points in all areas of knowledge answering the questions according to the board cases.

140162.name: The Lost Dutchman: Pixel Prospector Player Board
140162.description: An additional player board for The Lost Dutchman. The Pixel Prospector has a cheat code enabled and he will use it to his advantage as he searches the Superstition Mountains for The Lost Dutchman's Gold Mine!

140163.description:
Pandánte is a gambling game played by the Pandas of the Pandalands in the Fantasy Strike universe. In this game, lying is okay. (Humans use the softer term "bluffing".) You can lie about which abilities you have access to, and you can lie about whether your cards are strong enough to win the pot! And if you win a pot by lying, you gain the favor of a Panda Lord. Be careful, though, because other players can call you out on your lies for fun and profit.

Each round (called a "gambit"), players try to build the best hand they can from their two private cards and five community cards, similar to gameplay in Texas Hold'em Poker. Over the course of a gambit, players bet several times while making claims about how good their hands are and using abilities to influence the game. Each suit gives access to a different ability and if you don't have the one you need, just lie about it and hope you get away with it.

You can play Pandánte as a social game with a definite win condition and no player elimination, or you can play it as an ongoing gambling game in which players are eliminated when they lose their money, like in Poker. You could even play with real money if you're Panda enough.
140163.name: Pandánte
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12: An Octodog Leaves A Legacy Of Children On A Battlecruiser
Podcast #21: The Cardcast
The Board Room Episode three
The Boardgame Review Room: Pandante

boardgamecompilation: Duel in the Dark: 3-5 Player Variant
Duel in the Dark: Acoustic Mirror
Duel in the Dark: British 3.7in QF Anti-Aircraft Gun
Duel in the Dark: British Searchlight
Duel in the Dark: Ju88 Night Fighter
Duel in the Dark: Quad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Railroad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Skilled Gun Crew
Duel in the Dark: The Complete Edition – Expansion
Duel in the Dark: The Walls Have Ears
140164.description:
From the publisher's website:

World War 2 air combat game depicting the nighttime air raids of British bombers hitting German cities.

As the head of the British Bomber Command, you plan the attacks on Germany in order to undermine the morale of the civilian population. Or as a General of the German Air Force (Luftwaffe), you defend using your ace squadrons and organizing an effective civil defense.

The gameboard enables you to set up countless variations of these historic events. You play as many nights as you wish - each night takes 30-45 minutes to resolve.

Immerse yourself in the strategic and tactical thinking needed to survive in those dark times.

Gameplay allows for easy entry into the action with some advanced rules for the hearty wargamer. The game rules include weather conditions, full moon/new moon bonuses and penalties, clouds and thunderclouds, fog, flak, searchlights, balloon barriers, target markers, and much more.

The British player secretly plots the course of the bomber while the Mosquito acts as escort or decoy. The German player tries to figure out where the bomber is going, making sure to efficiently use the fuel to get as many hits on the bomber as possible.

THIS IS THE SECOND EDITION WHICH INCLUDES 9 EXPANSIONS


Ju88 Night Fighter
Railroad Flak (x2)
Accoustic Mirror
Quad Flak
Skilled Gun Crew
The Walls Have Ears
3-5 Player Variant
British 3.7in QF Anti-Aircraft Gun
British Searchlight


The box has a large "Includes 9 Expansions" logo on the cover.

Note that these are the same expansions that are provided in Duel in the Dark: The Complete Edition – Expansion.
140164.name: Duel in the Dark: Second Edition
boardgameexpansion: Duel in the Dark: Baby Blitz
Duel in the Dark: Early Nights
Duel in the Dark: Tactical Cards
Duel in the Dark: Window / Wilde Sau

140165.name: Dungeon Fighter: Black Sheep
140165.description:
The Black Sheep is a bonus monster card for Dungeon Fighter, distributed as the "goodie" in Plato Worldwide #2.


Blacksheep [sic] hates winners: inflicts its damage to the Hero with the highest number of life points.

Microcomputers in RPgs.

140170.name: Supper Time
140170.description:
This game is intended to teach children table manners in a fun and interactive setting.

By rolling the dice, players will advance their pawns around the board. By landing on each space, a new scenario is proposed and the parent can use the opportunity to instruct their child on table manners.

By answering correctly, the child would receive a card representing the space that was landed upon. The game ends when the child has all the cards in their hand.

140171.name: Armageddon Preppin
140171.description:
Preppin is a 2-4 player card game for ages 8+. The goal of the game is simple, keep your family alive and be the lone survivors of the cataclysmic disasters.

Each player is the head of a household trying to survive an onslaught of disasters. Every round you must decide how many of your family members will go out searching for supplies, and how many will stay sheltered. Family members who are sheltered, are safe from disasters. Those that go out, might not come back. Next you draw 1 card from any area pile of your choice for each unsheltered family member and place them into your hand. After you've drawn your cards, you take care of your upkeep by discarding 1 food card and 1 water card. If you can't, then you lose a family member to starvation or dehydration.

Once each player has taken a turn, the last player chooses a disaster card from the disaster deck of their choice. The red ones are the worst. The disasters effect everyone at the same time. In order to survive the effects, you need to use the surplus cards you've collected in your hand. For example: The Oil Crisis Disaster card is drawn. It takes 1 shelter and 1 food away from everyone, or else you lose 1 family member. In my hand I have 2 Waters, 1 Food, a Generator and a Gas Mask. I will discard my food and generator to survive the disaster.

After everyone has dealt with the disaster, the next round begins starting with the player to the left of the person who just drew the disaster. The game ends when there is only one player left, crowning them the most prepared.

140172.description:
Welcome to PELICAN BAY!
An exotic island world grows turn by turn under the warm sun – with water, beaches and tropical forests.

How to play
By placing tiles we enlarge the exotic paradise step by step. Who enlarges areas skillfully and is able to close as many areas as possible to attract blue pelicans has the best chances of winning.
The sun discs offer interesting blockade possibilities.
140172.name: Pelican Bay

140173.name: Zombicide Survivor: Ross
140173.description:
Ross was leading a peaceful life as a warehouse manager when the zombies appeared. Ross, however, is more than he appears. He left the army twenty years ago with scars and PTSD but believed he had moved on. The invasion triggered something in him, something dirty he had thought buried forever. His soldier's instincts came roaring back, along with old wounds. His tactical awareness and skill with weapons, however, are priceless to any survivor team. If he would just put down his bowling ball...

Ross is a promotional character available as an option for backers of the Season 2 Kickstarter campaign. The figure includes English, French, and Spanish language versions of the weapon card "Ross' Bowling Ball".

140175.name: Graf Zeppelin's Reisen durch Deutschland
140175.description:
Objective: be the first making a round trip over Germany (1-50) to Friedrichshafen
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on lid inside
remarks:
should had been published during 1928-36

140176.name: Lords of New York
140176.description:
It's 1925. Prohibition is in full swing, alchohol is forbidden and business is booming for the mafia. Speakeasies and jazz clubs are packed every night. New York City is alive with a new-found freedom where anything is possible.

Source: The Game Website.


Lords of New York is an adventure RPG game where you follow the story of one of three high stakes poker players as they pursue their life's ambitions and become one of New York's elite.

Each character has unique gameplay, end goals and poker style (cheating, intuition or statistics) all designed to support a compelling story arc. While the paths of their stories may cross, they are completely different, increasing the game's replayability.

Source: The Kickstarter Page.

140177.name: Augen Auf! Das neue Verkehrsspiel
140177.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100 (P); learn traffic signs
- moving by turns -
Simple Roll & Move game; ending on a marked space follow instructions on the lid inside. The players can choose between beeing a car driver, motorcyclist or pedestrian. They have to follow the traffic rules and use the travel routes accordingly. The pedestrian has only 50 spaces to travel, so his rolls count only half (round up)! The traffic cop stands on space 58. Any player who rolls a 6 may rotate the traffic cop to restrict the movement of the opposing players.

remarks: published before and during WWII

140178.name: Das schöne Märchenspiel
140178.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (12)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a red marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
published ~ 1920's
added: a cardboard-die

140179.name: De Poorters van Nieuwstad
140179.description:
'De Poorters van Nieuwstad' originated from a unique collaboration between a group of about 3000 gamers and 999Games-lovers. Through the project, called "The Perfect Game", we have tried to create a perfect game. So, everyone could vote for: the game system, duration of the game, number of players, concept, title and artwork. The gamers decided upon the elements and the basis. On this basis, people could send in games concepts, add from those, Tycho van den Broek emerged as the winner. 999Games has developed the concept and the wishes of the voters into a complete game!

In this exciting board game, players found a new city. This develops through the construction of new buildings, growing the number of Burghers ("Poorters") that live there. As prosperity increases, the Burghers replace the surrounding forest wuth green pastures and waving fields of grain. In the city, stately mansions are erected and is worked at the City Hall, the Hospice and other community buildings.

On your turn, you always choose a character, such as the Lumberjack or the Sheriff. THen, all players can perform this character's action. You get a privilege added to this action. You can earn points by placing buildings and selling much needed food. The game includes different specialists such as the Baker, the Fishmonger and the Tavern. As a result, there are infinitely many strategic options. But the Middle Ages were certainly not free of hazards such as crime, wolves plague and the Black Death, which may appear through the playing of cards. If you are the first to score 30 points, you win the game.

140182.name: Monopoly: Vodafone
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140182.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the phone company Vodafone
remarks:
Second edition published ~2011

140183.name: Monopoly: hci Capital
140183.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the company hci Capital

140184.name: Monopoly: Devil EDV Distribution
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140184.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the company Devil, EDV Distribution

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)

140188.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the
the two locations Werdenberg and Obertoggenburg, in Switzerland

140189.name: Monopoly: Esslingen

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Reutlingen, a city south of Stuttgart

140191.name: Chuggington Top Trumps Activity Pack
140191.description:
A selection of games and puzzles aimed at the very young, using characters from the Chuggington TV series. Altogether there are three different games and 4 puzzles to keep a young mind busy.

Naturally, there is a pre-school Top Trumps game with 12 cards. Each train is rated for Speed, Friendship, Adventure and Wisdom and each is illustrated in colour. This will be a short game which is right for the age group - they won't have time to get bored.

Secondly, you can play Pairs with the cards because there are 12 cards giving a description of each of the twelve trains. So the player won't find an exact match but will be able to find, say, two Chatsworth train cards.

Thirdly, there is a simple which is played a little like Rummy but much easier. You have a hand of five cards and you draw a card (from the stack or the top of the discard pile). If you get a matching pair, you may lay it down and discard one of your other cards on to the discard pile. The first person to get rid of all their cards, wins.

140192.name: Monopoly: Zürich
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140192.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Zurich, a city in Switzerland

140193.name: Close Combat: Panthers in the Fog
140193.description:
Close Combat: Panthers in the Fog is the latest release in the critically-acclaimed Close Combat series. It details the desperate German counter-attack at Mortain, the last chance of the Wehrmacht to stave off defeat in Normandy. Can you match the tenacity of the American defenders of Hill 314? Or can you succeed where the Panzers failed, driving through to the sea and changing history?

Play single battles, linked operations, or even the Grand campaign simulating all six crucial days of fighting. With 35 linked battlefields and historically accurate formations and units, strategic choices are as important as tactical prowess. New features of long-range interdiction, strategic high ground and adverse weather conditions bring an insight into the challenges faced by those who commanded both sides in this pivotal WW2 battle.

Command your forces on the strategic level, issuing orders to battalion or regimental-sized units to attack or defend, and allocate air or artillery support. Then fight out the resulting engagements in a highly-detailed, real-time simulation of World War II tactical combat. The results of the tactical battle determine who controls each area, and where they can move at the strategic level.

For the Allies the Normandy landings of June were followed by two months of hard fighting in difficult terrain against a tenacious German defense. But in late July the U.S. Army’s Operation Cobra has finally created a decisive breach in the weakened German line. Patton’s 3rd Army races through the opening along the western coast of France and into the clear, driving for the Brittany Ports. Faced with the choice between retreat and last-ditch counter-attack, the Germans struggle to assemble a panzer force for one more charge. Can the Germans move quickly enough to overcome a desperate situation, push through to Avranches on the French coast, and cut off Patton’s racing spearheads? Or will the thinly stretched Americans troops screening Patton’s flank be able to hold out, regroup, and hold the vital lifeline open?

Source: The Publisher Website.

140194.name: ZinZig
140194.description: ZinZig is a wine-themed trivia game designed to both test knowledge and educate players. It requires the addition of two or three bottles of wine for gameplay purposes. Players take turns to roll and move on spaces around the circular board, receiving a wine-related trivia question each turn. A successfully answered question is rewarded with one of the four resources (barrel, grape, bottle, and cork). Some spaces allow for special actions along with the trivia question (including swapping, trading, or stealing resources). A player who has collected all four resources may enter the center of the board, "production," no longer rolling to move but instead progressing through four final stages (crushing, fermenting, aging, and bottling). The first player to complete the production stages is the winner.

140195.name: Rundstedt's East Front
140195.description:
Designed by Kita-Kitsune.

This is a mini size card-driven game covering the Eastern Front of WW2 from September '41 to June '42.
The map uses point to point system from Odessa to Rostov.
This game uses improved card-driven system in which players start with the determined deck but can purchase additional card by using specific event card.

Victory is determined by VPs which can be gained via control of important cities.

140196.name: Hairy Tales
videogamehonor: 2013 Indie Prize Most Innovative Game Winner
140196.description:
What is Hairy Tales?

A "fiendishly difficult" puzzle/action game that has been praised for its creativity and multiple solutions, Hairy Tales combines tile-dragging mechanics with fast furious action. It's inspired by ChuChu Rocket and Lemmings, and tells the zany adventures of a group of not too bright folk spirits, as you help them puzzle out evil conundrums in their mission to save their tile-based world from sickening corruption.

It stars the Hairys, an excitable group of fairy folk who are so eager to clear their world of corruption that they simply don't watch where they're going. It's up to you to organize the stages in the best way possible for them to reach their goal while avoiding enemies, dealing with the corruption and eventually defeating dangerous enemies.

It has 72 levels split across three distinctive worlds, where players must simultaneously save the Hairys from falling off the edge of the world by re-arranging the tiles on each level, while acquiring power ups, magic mushrooms and destroying evil enemy Kikimoras and their three powerful end bosses.

Features
- Unique combination of tile-dragging puzzles with action-strategy mechanics.
- Hardcore puzzle difficulty but allowing casual-length game sessions.
- Fully-alterable world with a great tactile feel and intuitive interaction.
- Difficult puzzles with multiple solutions, which allow you to find your own path and provide replayability.
- Colorful environments with hilarious characters, animations and sound.
- Distinctive enemies and end-boss puzzle battles.

Source: The Developer Website.

140197.name: Speedy Bee
140197.description:
Speedy Bee is an observation and speed ​​game.

The bees are looking for pollen. The first player who have six pollens wins the game.

The game includes three designed dices with four small balls representing the primary colors (blue, yellow, red) and black.

The board has six pollen balls, three with the color of the dices and three representing the mix between the primary colors (green, purple and orange). And the black color is used for the queen of the bees at the center of the board.

Each turn, one player rolls the dices and then all players have to catch the correct pollen balls depending on the color dices and according to the color mixing rules.

If you get the correct ball, you win a pollen token. If you are wrong, you have to give one back.

140198.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Millennium Falcon Bounce Game
140198.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

From the publisher:

Bounce into action with the new Angry Birds Star Wars Millennium Falcon Bounce Game. Bounce three balls at the Millennium Falcon to knock down as many enemy pigs as possible, and land in the cockpit to score big! Players can also unlock Angry Birds Star Wars in-app content with a special code in each pack.

140200.name: Galactic Keep
140200.description:
Galactic Keep: Dice Battles takes core elements of classic dice and paper role playing games and translates them into an iPhone and iPad experience. Set in a dark, sci-fi universe with a strange cast of characters, this uniquely crafted and hand-drawn game is like no other iPhone title out there. Grab loot, battle monsters, mod and level up various characters, unlock new classes and species, and solve item-based puzzles in this modern sim of a classic-feeling tabletop RPG.

Source: The Game Website.

140201.name: Monopoly: Migros
140201.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Migros, a company in Switzerland

140202.name: Monopoly: Bietigheimer Wohnbau
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140202.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bietigheimer Wohnbau, a company from Bietigheim (city north of Stuttgart)

140203.name: Epic Battle Fantasy 4
140203.description:
User Summary

Epic Battle Fantasy is a turn-based RPG in the style of Final Fantasy by Matt Roszak with artwork by Matt Roszak and music by HalcyonicFalconX. Features include upgradable equipment, a skill point system with over 130 skills and spells to learn, and 120 types of monsters. Features new to the series include a new party member, additional mouse controls, a world map, and a much larger game world.

140204.name: Monopoly: Mars edition
140204.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from a pet food company, located in Germany
remarks:
equipped with cute wooden meeples

140205.name: Kalory
140205.description:
"Kalory: A game for all fun loving, weight conscious people!"

Kalory is a roll-and-move, weight-loss-themed Monopoly derivative which instructs players on methods of losing weight.

After rolling dice, players move their playing pieces around the board, gaining or losing Kalory chips (which represent weight). They also perform actions on cards that they draw, depending on which space they land on. The first player to lose all of their Kalory chips is the winner.

Players may select different game lengths: a lightweight game, a middleweight game, or a heavyweight game. The game length corresponds to an increasing number of starting Kalory chips.

140206.name: Monopoly: Sharp Solar
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140206.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Sharp Solar, a company located in Germany

140207.name: Hannah Montana Music Game
140207.description:
Card game for diehard Hannah Montana fans because you will need to know her songs very well.

Shuffle the deck and place one card face-up next to it. This is the start of the discard pile. Shuffle the Points cards (they vary from 1 to 10 points).

The main cards have a symbol on them. That is important. The symbols are;

Music note: name the title of a Hannah Montana song which includes the word on the card.
Flower: sing 2 lines from the chorus of a Hannah Montana song, which includes the words on the card.
Butterfly: say 3 things about the character on the card.
Star: this is the secret Joker card! Draw a point card without having to carry out an assignment. All other players are required to draw an action card!

The Play. If the player has an action card, of which the colour or symbol corresponds with the top card of the discard pile, he/she can discard it.
If the symbol is identical, then he/she can execute the assignment (see above) on the card he/she is discarding. The other players will judge whether the assignment is successful. If the assignment is successful, then the player can draw 1 points card. If both the symbol and the colour are the same, then the player can draw two points cards! If the assignment was unsuccessful, then the player does not get to draw a points card.
If the symbol is different, but the colour is the same, then he/she does not get to carry out an assignment.
If the player does not have a suitable action card (other symbol and other colour), then he/she has to draw another action card.

The player who has collected the most points when the Points cards have run out is the winner, the Secret Star of the Music Game!

140208.name: Moon Base
140208.description:
From the Introduction:

To the untrained eye the moon's surface might look featureless and dreadfully monotonous. And it is true, that this crater seems to be only one among many. Only once an observer gets close to the crater's edge will the base inside the crater become obvious. The base is not much to look at, still two habitat modules have been set up close to the crater wall promising a safe haven. In addition a ramp has been erected connecting the floor of the crater with the higher surrounding ground. While this ramp is wide enough for various vehicles it is not particular sturdy. Even given the moon's low gravity it would be reckless to traverse it with heavy vehicles.

140209.name: Tennis Court
140209.description:
From the Introduction:

Almost next to a street lies this small amateur tennis court for the neighborhood. The simple sand court is surrounded by a mesh fence, to stop one or another errant tennis ball, and a low mowed lawn. Inside the fenced in enclosure two simple wooden benches and trashcan sit along one of the courts long sides. Outside the mesh fence a concrete wall on a small paved field allows players without a partner to practice their swings.

140210.name: Moon Landing
140210.description:
From the Introduction:

To the untrained eye the moon's surface might look featureless and dreadfully monotonous. Along this small cliff face, possibly the remnant of an old crater, lies one place of importance though. In the bright light and heat of the lunar day a lander has touched down at this spot, marking it with a small flag for all posterity as one of the few spots where man has set foot on their home planet’s natural satellite. In this barren, airless desert the small lunar lander is the only source of hospitality, what little it can provide, far and wide.

140211.name: Monopoly: KanAm Grund
140211.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from KanAm Grund, a company located in Germany

140212.name: Monopoly: Otra Süd
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
140212.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Otra Süd, a company from Germany

140213.name: Mad Libs Criss Cross
140213.description: Before the game begins each player customizes several of the cards with names of family members, friends, pets etc. in Mad Libs Criss Cross Game. Then each player picks nine cards from the card tray and puts them onto their card holder (3 Nouns, 3 Verbs and 3 Misc.). The first player lays down a sentence made of cards and counts up the total score which is printed on the individual cards. The next player lays down a sentence crossing over or adding to the previous sentence and adds up the score. When all of the cards are used or no one else can make a sentence the game is over. Object of the Game: The player with the most points wins.

140214.name: Amazing Alex
140214.description:
Meet Amazing Alex! With his boundless imagination, this whiz kid turns everything into adventure! From cleaning his room to battling cardboard robots in his backyard, Alex creates amazing chain reactions to get the job done. Now he has some challenges for you! What's the most creative solution YOU can create? With 100 challenging levels, there's a whole world of creations to explore!

Source: The Developer Website.

140215.description:
Catan Shop Description
Here is a complete replacement set of game cards for use with Catan: Traders and Barbarians®.

Components:

47 Traders & Barbarians Cards
27 Barbarian Attack Cards
38 Catan Event Cards
5 Fisherman Cards
3 Catalog Cards
140215.name: Traders and Barbarians Game Cards

140216.name: Das lustige Drogistenspiel
140216.description:
"The funny game of druggists" published by Julius Süss, Leipzig, Germany in 1920. It is the typical children's roll and move board game with interesting theme - children's games in pharmacy store.
The goal of the game - to pass the pharmacy store first (pass the 110 stops).

Game board measures - 29 x 44 cm.

140217.name: Command Ops: Highway to the Reich
videogameexpansion: Command Ops: Battles from the Bulge
140217.description:
As the first official expansion pack for the award winning Command Ops series, Command Ops: Highway to the Reich from acclaimed developer Panther Games brings us to the setting of one of the most epic and controversial battles of World War II: Operation Market-Garden. The Highway to the Reich expansion pack is a set of 13 scenarios covering all of the major actions that took place during the Market Garden Campaign in Holland during September 1944.

The scenarios cover every major engagement along Hell’s Highway, from the surprise capture of Joe’s Bridge by the Irish Guards a week before the offensive to the final battles on “The Island” south of Arnhem. The dramatic parachute and glider landings of the US 82nd and 101st Airborne, The British 1st Airborne and the Polish Brigade are all represented on some of the largest maps ever created for the series and the largest “campaign” scenario in this system to date. More than just a conversion of the old scenarios to play on the new system, the Expansion Pack represents a major update of Panther Games ground breaking classic game Highway to the Reich, incorporating numerous corrections to Maps, Orders of Battle, Unit Compositions, Reinforcement Schedules, and overall game play.

Command Ops: Highway to the Reich is an expansion for Command Ops: Battles from the Bulge and requires the base game to play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140218.name: Fairy Mischief
140218.description:
Designed by Jay and Susie Hernishin for their daughter, Fairy Mischief is a light game designed to help younger gamers transition into more advanced gaming with the goal of making more girl analog gamers!

Players take on the roles of fairies competing in displays of magic. The fairies will duel one another over colorful gem pieces that are randomly drawn from a satchel (watch out for the powerful black stones that grant special abilities). When one fairy has won a gem of each of the five colors, they win!

The basic game uses the classic game of War (players win duels by flipping over the top three cards of their deck and comparing who has the highest cards in a best-of-three fashion) combined with other elements to introduce the players to "gamery" skills (collection, special powers, and randomness).

There are also more advanced ways to play, so the game can grow with or adapt to kids. New concepts include (push-your-luck, hand ranks, informed guessing, discard pile awareness, etc.)

140219.name: Textra
140219.description:
Textra is word game, that consist of a plastic container, 206 letter tiles and 4 letter trays - clearly inspired by Scrabble, but the main gimmick here is the plastic container with clever mechanism to separate vowels and consonants. In the container you have trail where you put your letter tiles to make words. And when the trail is full (something like 15 tiles), the first used letters drop in to two departments one for vowels and other for consonants.

When you start the game, the first player puts one vowel and one consonant in any order in to the trail and then every player gets six letter tiles to make words. You can choose the distribution of vowels and consonants at the start of the game and always when you refill your tile tray. At the players turn you try to make a word using as many already laid letters in a trail as the first letters of your new word. Rest of your word consists of letters you have in your tray. You just put the letters from your tray to the trail to make a new word. Then you multiply newly added letters with letters you used from the previous ones and that makes your points. You fill your hand and then it is the next players turn.

Example: "AUTO" becomes "autoMATIC" (4*5=20 pts.), then "ticK" (3*1), then "tickLE" (4*2) etc.

In a four player game you play to the end of the round, when someone gets total of 60 points. Winner is the player who got the most points. In three player game you play until 80 points and with two players until 100 points. When playing alone you just decide number of rounds and try to make as many points as as you can.

You can play this game as long as you like, because the used letters are dropping back to containers departments, which is the same place where you take the new letter tiles. There is 100 vowel tiles and 100 consonant tiles and six wild tiles in the game. There's quite a few letters missing, that are used in Finnish language. Letter distribution of the game is: vowels: (40*A, 10*E, 20*I 15*O, 15*U) and consonants: (5*H, 5*J, 15*K, 15*L, 5*M, 10*N, 5*P, 5*R, 10*S, 20*T, 5*V). You can play the game in any language, where you can make enough words with these letters. Because of "the clever" mechanism, the vowel tiles are bit smaller than the consonant tiles.

140220.name: Gary Grigsby's War in the East: Don to the Danube
videogameexpansion: Gary Grigsby's War In The East: The German-Soviet War 1941-1945
140220.description:
The critically and fan acclaimed Eastern Front mega-game Gary Grigsby’s War in the East just got bigger and better with Gary Grigsby’s War in the East: Don to the Danube! This expansion to the award-winning War in the East comes with a wide array of later war scenarios ranging from short but intense 6 turn bouts like the Battle for Kharkov (1942) to immense 37-turn engagements taking place across multiple nations like Drama on the Danube (Summer 1944 – Spring 1945). Don to the Danube and the War in the East system gives players unprecedented control over pivotal operations in the Second World War like Operation Uranus, the encirclement of the 6th German Army at Stalingrad, the Cherkassy Pocket and much more. Don to the Danube also takes full advantage of the hefty number of new features and rule changes that come with the massive 1.06.00 update and incorporates a full new Editor manual as well.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140221.name: Thüringer Land wie bist du schön
140221.description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Erfurt (Thuringia)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions...
remarks:
published ~1950's in the GDR

140223.name: Bungees
140223.description:
This is a very light (but difficult-to-master) dexterity game with collectable figurines made of a rubbery material. The game board is magnetic, and so is the bottom of every figure.

There are several modes of play, but all of them involve flicking your figurine(s), trying to get them to land on certain spots of the game board.

The figurines are mostly sold in single, blind-purchase booster packs (although there are some other packages available).

140224.name: Ein Bummel um die Welt
140224.description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Berlin
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game: choose one of the coloured routes around the world; ending on a marked space follow instructions...

140225.description:

140229.name: Nexus Nine Netbook 1: Northern Gun
140229.description:
From Introduction:


Required Books for a NG Setting

No Northern Gun Setting would be complete without the expansive NG Catalog. That Catalog is spread out amongst a number of quality Rifts Books. Thus, for all of the various weapons, equipment and canon history, Nexus Nine recommends the following books when running a NG game:

RIFTS (Main Book)
Source Book 1
World Book 10: Juicer Uprising
World Book 11: Coalition War Campaign (for Treaty Info)
World Book 13: Lone Star
World Book 14: New West
World Book 20: Canada
Rifts Mercenaries
Merctown
Merc Ops

140230.name: Slawia
140230.description:
Publisher blurb:

The 6th expansion for the Polish RPG system Wolsung: Magia Wieku Pary (known in English as Wolsung: Steam Pulp Fantasy and released by Studio 2 Publishing).

This nationbook is entirely devoted to Slavia, a land which in the steampunk world of Wolsung is the counterpart of Poland, the mother country of the authors of the game. The country known also as the Cursed Republic was established by the only ancient hero who, after defeating a dragon, killed it instead of making a pact. The dying beast put a curse on Piastun and all his ancestors...

The nationbook contains:

- description of 9 Voivodships, 2 Free Cities and one colonial experiment;
- 20 Slavian specialties;
- 9 organizations, together with unique Edges, gadgets and achievements;
- over 30 personages to make your adventures more colorful;
- unique legacy: Slavian nobleman;
- information about the Draconic Curse and its influence on the everyday life in Slavia;
- information about the history of the country, crazy theories, powerful artifacts and unsolved mysteries;
- new optional rules: the curse, daring stunts, pacts with fiends;
- detailed description of the crazy Slavian politics, including a random generator of political party names;
- 14 antagonists from the wildest corners of Slavia
- 244 ideas for adventures.

140232.name: Monopoly: Equipe de France
140232.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the winning French soccer team 2000

140233.name: Demon Heart Falling
140233.description:
From Introduction:

NOTES FROM THE TIME MACHINE

I wrote "Demon Bean Falling" in the winter of 1994/1995, when I was a senior at the University of Notre Dame. I'd been running a regular RIFTS campaign for my friends since 1990, and had become obsessed with two things: becoming a writer, and working for Palladium Books. The material in this book (along with the material in its companion, "The Banwok Hunters") reflect a lot of the original material I wrote and used in my ongoing RIFTS campaign during that time.

I submitted both the manuscript for this book and "The Banwok Hunters" to Palladium Books in the spring of 1995. For a while, it looked like Palladium might publish them. Ultimately, they didn't. I learned a lot from that experience, though, and ultimately it helped me to get published, and to become a better writer.

Both "Demon Heart Falling" and "The Banwok Hunters" were put in storage, and were forgotten. I moved on to other games, and other things.

Fast-forward just about fifteen years later, to the fall of 2009.

While looking for some other old games in the attic, I found one of the original copies of "Demon Heart Falling" - probably the only copy still in existence. I'd printed some copies of it for my friends way back in the day, complete with a cover and comb binding. I'd assumed that all copies - including my own - were long-lost to the ravages of time. Wrong. Here was the last copy, staring me in the face.

So I re-read it. And liked it.

It's not the greatest book in the world, I'II be honest. For that matter, it's probably not good. It's decent. It's an excellent reflection of the author I was back then - raw, hungry, passionate, and practically exploding with ideas. It lacks a lot of the polish and refinement needed from a more experienced writer, which could've made it into something far better than what it was. But it's not terrible. It's just a glimpse at the author I was, and the author I would become.

So I present it to you, for your enjoyment. If you can use any of this stuff in your own RIFTS game, awesome. Let me know about it. If not ... well, I hope you enjoy what you read, and it at least makes you smile.

Warts, flaws and all, I'm proud of this one. It told me that I could be a writer.

140234.name: The Banwok Hunters
140234.description:
From Introduction:

" The Banwok Hunters" is a sourcebook intended for the RIFTS roleplaying game.

It's also a snapshot of one of the happiest parts of my life.

I ran a regular RIFTS campaign between 1990 and 1996. For my friends in my regular gaming group - and for myself - that was an amazing time. The games back then were filled with a lot of excitement, a lot of fun, a lot of inspired insanity, and a hell of a lot of laughter.

I spent a lot of time writing adventures and designing new rules and source material for that campaign. At some point, I thought it might be a good idea to formally write up my notes in the form of a book. Little did I know that nearly fifteen years later, this would be the very first step I would take towards becoming a professionally published freelancer in the gaming industry.

"The Banwok Hunters" essentially represents a "best of" look at that campaign, and at my own first attempts at writing something for a gaming company.

Enjoy!

I know my old gaming group did.

140235.name: Bolt Action: Assault on Normandy
140235.description:
Bolt Action: Assault on Normandy brings to you everything you need to pit your tactics and wits against your opponent as you recreate the great battles of World War II on the tabletop! In addition to the glorious Bolt Action rulebook and eight Orders Dice, you will find forty hard plastic, multi-pose 28mm miniatures as well as terrain for them to fight over. This is a great starting point as you seek to defeat your foes and bring an end to the greatest conflict in history.

This introductory boxed set includes miniatures from two factions – German and Americans – allowing two players to learn the basic rules of the game. Using miniature soldiers, tanks and terrain, you can fight battles in the shattered towns of occupied France, either liberating or holding the position according your faction. By moving miniatures that represent troops and vehicles (like Sherman tanks or half trucks) along a scenery-filled tabletop and using dice to resolve shooting or attacking actions as well as leadership tests, you attempt to finish the enemy army or achieve certain objectives.

140236.description:
Convert is a two player abstract strategy board game. Two opposing players each have a set of 10 differently shaped wooden blocks that are played on a 4x4 board with alternating black and white squares.

By manipulating pieces to fit on the board, as well as with each other, players attempt to score rows of four while claiming spaces on the board by converting them to their color.

When a player's piece completes a row of four squares, that player scores one point. When all pieces are played, or when neither player can play a piece, players add the points they scored during game-play to the amount of squares they have claimed on the board.

The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Microbadges

Convert fan
140236.name: Convert
boardgamepodcastepisode: Abstract Impressionism - Episode 14
Origins Spectacular 2015

140237.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Munchkin Zombies Decay d6 features six custom six-sided acrylic dice previously available only in a limited release. Three of them are swirled pearlescent red with pus-yellow pips; three of them are swirled pearlescent ivory with blood-red pips, and all six feature a Munchkin head in place of the one. You want them so you can kill the monsters and take their stuff!

Munchkin Zombies Decay d6 also includes four exclusive new cards for Munchkin Zombies!
140237.name: Munchkin Zombies Decay d6

140238.name: Aastaring Aias
140238.description:
Educational board game for kindergartens about vegetables.

There is track on topside of the board and various vegetables growing on the game board under the track.
Player rolls the dice in his turn and moves accordingly on the track. If child lands on square where the name of vegetable is written he/she must recognize this vegetable from the board. Then he/she rolls again and the dice show one of the six categories player must answer the question about this vegetable.
If the answer is incorrect the player moves backward 3 squares.

Player who finishes first is the winner.

140239.name: 6180 the moon
140239.description:
'6180 the moon' is a platformer game with a unique mechanic. It offers a fresh, unseen game play style by connecting the top and bottom of the screen. This allows in a mechanic with delightfully long jumps and no fear of "slipping" to death.

In addition to the unique gameplay, '6180 the moon' delivers a unique storyline. The Sun has gone. The Moon sets off on a journey to find the Sun. Along the journey will be hazardous courses and deep realizations.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140240.name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
140240.description:
The game commences from the Sydney side of the Bridge marked Home and continues over the proposed scenic railway to the North Shore, and back along, the main roadway of the Bridge following the numbers from No. 1 to 100.
Each player throws the dice in turn it being necessary to throw a 6 to commence the journey.
The first player to return to Home wins the game.

140241.name: Age of Essence Rule Book
140241.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Seven Kingdoms, you stand on a continent torn apart by a war that befell us all almost 780 years before now. Before then there was truce between all the races and with the land itself, no one is sure what it was that set the Elves to war but it consumed everything from west to east. For twenty years there was conflict, blood and debris filled the land until one day it all fell silent, no one today knows what truly happened but there were celebrations across all the kingdoms. The aftermath of the war left the seas inaccessible to anyone, raging torrents of storms and seas prevent any ship from sailing to or from the land, the continent shuddered and shifted creating unexplained volcanoes, nothing was spared in the elements mournful wake. A new reform was made so that no war so destructive should ever be brought forth again. To uphold this reform Guilds were created, these guilds are there to keep the balance and to this day still hold great influence across the continent. Many have found honor and glory where others have found wealth and great knowledge. The world turns and now, seven hundred and seventy eight years later things begin to stir in the great forests, dark hearts leak out of the pores of shadows and even magic turns and rebels against itself. These are troubled times and your tale has yet to be told. Will you seek fame and fortune like those before you? Or will your exploits bring about your untimely demise. Whatever the outcome remember that time is of the essence.

140242.description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive promo for all backers getting at least 1 copy of Dragon's Hoard.

According to the designer of the base game, this card "allows a player to stay safe from actions like wizards, knights, and angry mobs for an entire round, and aids in the acquisition of a highly valuable treasure".

(Source: Kickstarter page for Dragon's Hoard.)
140242.name: Dragon's Hoard: Unicorn Promo

140243.description:
Contains a complete Red Block company for AT-43 the ready assembled and painted miniatures game.
• 1 unit of 12 Krasnye Soldaty: regular infantry containing three grenade launchers, two medics and an officer
• 1 unit of 8 Krasnye Soldaty: regular infantry containing one grenade launcher, two mechanics and an officer
• 6 Dragonov Kommandos: elite infantry with one sniper rifle, an electronic warfare specialist, a medic and an officer
• Odin O-1 and Manon O-2: the Red Blok’s two greatest heroes
• 1 Urod: Odin O-1’s and Manon O-2’s combat strider
• 1 Dotch Yaga: the most heavily armored combat strider to ever grace the battlefield
• 6 low walls
• 1 container
• Introductory Rules
• 1 Red Blok revolutionary forces tactical manual
• 1 game poster
• 12 dice
• 1“Red Blok” ruler
• 1 explosion template
• 26 game cards
140243.name: AT-43 Army Box: Red Blok

140244.description:
Chains to Champions is a gladiator themed board game that consists of three phases. In phase one you purchase a gladiator at an auction, in phase two you equip your gladiator with weapons, helmets, armor, and training, and then in phase three all players fight to the death in the Arena. The last man standing wins!

From the back of the box: "Hurry, hurry! The auction is about to begin! There are many gladiators from which to choose. If you choose wisely, you could end up with riches beyond your wildest dreams. If you choose poorly, your gladiator may end up splattered on the sand of the arena. However, the strength behind the swing of his sword isn’t the only thing it takes to make your gladiator a champion. You’ll have access to the finest training and weapons that Rome has to offer before your gladiator is tossed into the arena for a merciless fight to arena in chains, but only one will emerge a champion.

Chains to Champions combines mathematical probability with human ingenuity to create a strategy game that is unique each time you play."
140244.name: Chains To Champions

140245.name: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
140245.description:
Do you have what it takes to survive?
The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct is a first-person action survival game that brings to life the authentic, heart-stopping horrors of the AMC Emmy® award-winning TV series The Walking Dead. In the game, players assume the role of the mysterious, crossbow-wielding survivor Daryl Dixon, brought to life by TV series star Norman Reedus, alongside his overbearing brother Merle, voiced by costar Michael Rooker. Join them on a haunting, unforgiving quest across the Georgia countryside.

Tread carefully in the post-apocalyptic world as you scavenge for weapons and supplies.

Source: The Game Website.

140246.name: Monopoly: Quickfunds Dubai
140246.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Quickfunds Dubai, a company located in Germany.

140247.name: Monopoly: Key-Systems
140247.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Key-Systems, a company located in Germany

140248.name: Captain's Log #6
140248.description:
Data: 48 pages, 9 scenarios, 2 new SSD, 14 new ships described, Star Fleet Battles Tournament Book

From the back cover:
B-10 Briefing: Everything you wanted to know about the largest warship ever build in the Star Fleet Universe. Technical drawings, history of all nine B-10s, shuttle bays diagrams, SSDs for the B-10V supercarrier and the B-10S space control ship, conversion data for the Romulan KB-10R, seven scenarios covering the battles, real and potential, in which the ships fought, and exciting story A meeting of Giants, an account of the first join Klingon-Federation battle against the Andromedans.

Tournament Book: The complete 1988 official Star Fleet Battles tournament rules and SSDs, allowing you to conduct, prepare for, and participate in official SFB championship battles.

Star Fleet Database: Information you can use about Star Fleet Universe. Announcements, your questions answered, product schedules, communications. Why?, Urgent Addenda, examples, advice, and more.

The Academy: The latest tactical advice: Term Papers gives you tips from the aces, Tactics Board will reveal the fallacies in your strategy, and the ever-popular Ask Uncle Ardakexplains how to avoid a wild weasel explosion.

Scenarios: More exciting challenges from the history of Star Fleet Universe. Romulans ambush the Gorns in the "The Wreck of the Rex", rescue lost souls from "The Graveyard of Ships", battle a race of mind-controlling plants in "My Brother, My Enemy".

Federation & Empire: Tactical notes, your questions answered, and an in-depth look at Direct Damage, the most important combat rule in the Federation and Empire strategic system.

140249.name: Captain's Log #5
140249.description:
Data: 48 pages, 5 scenarios, 2 new SSD, 14 new ships described, D15.0 Simplified Ground Combat Module

From the back cover:
The Day of the Eagle: The dramatic story of the day the Romulans attacked the federation, turning a border war with the Kilngons into a two-front battle for the survival of humanity. This section includes three exciting fictions stories and a map showing the deployment of the Federation Sixth Fleet on the crucial day.

And the Republic...: After defeating one squadron of Romulan raiders, the old starship Republic is attacked by another Romulan force seeking revenge.

Encounter at Denebola: As the War begins, a Federation task force including the old cruiser Reshadije is dispatched to negotiate a treaty with the Orion base at Denobola-IV, only to find that the Romulans have their own offer to make.

Surprise Reversed: The long awaited true story of how Commodore Anthony Stocker surprised a Romulan fleet and destroyed it, and what happened to Stocker and the command cruiser Lexington after their victory.

Star Fleet Universe Timeline: A completely updated version of the timeline originally published in Nexus #1, including all historical scenarios.

Updated Master Ship Chart: A completely updated edition of the most important chart in the Star Fleet Battles game system, including new ships from SSD books #7, #8, and #9, as well as those published in the Addenda.

New Scenarios: New challenges for the Star Fleet Univers. Federation shuttles flee from a pursuing Klingon PF flotilla. Hydran PFs launch a suicide attack against an antire Klingon fleet.

Star Fleet Battles Addenda: The lates rules update, including updated information on all scenarios showing refits for thew ship in those scenarios, plus important clarifications for many other rules sections.

140250.name: Captain's Log #7
140250.description:
Data: 48 pages, 5 scenarios, 4 new SSD

From the back cover:

What Price for Victory? The gripping story of Captain Merrin Hunter, Star Fleet's only female cruiser captain, locked in a mortal test of will with Klingon Captain Keng, with a vital Federation outpost hanging in the balance. Can Hunter triumph? And what will the victory cost to her? And what of Katia Kor, Keng's female first officer?

Klingon Officers: Everything you ever wanted to know about the officers of a D7 Battlecruiser. Who they are. How they are trained and promoted. Where they work and where they fight. The key difference between line and technical officers.
