Star Fleet Universe Index: A comprehensive index of people, ships. planets, races, star systems, bases, animals, monsters, terms, and numbered military units from the Star Fleet Universe background, fiction, and scenarios.

Star Fleet Database: Data you can use about the Star Fleet Universe. Announcements, answers to your questions, products releases an Input Guide, communications, Why?, Urgent Addenda, examples, and the new Battleforce-500.

The Academy: The latest tactical advises. The largest section of Term Papers ever gives you advice from the Aces. The Tactics Board exposes the fallacies in your strategy, Uncle Ardak explains how to get drones hit a Lyran CA, and the Plasma Ballet will give you some new ideas on plasma tactics.

Scenarios: Federation and Romulan squadrons battle for a captured mauler, Hydran fighters overrun a convoy of Klingon booms, a Federation survey cruiser raids a pirate base, and the Masters play their greatest game of all: Space Hockey!

New SSDs: Federation battlecruiser New Jersey (six photons!), Hydran Apache light command cruiser, Klingon MD5 mauler, and the Lyran Single-Tooth Jaguar mauler.

Federation & Empire: Tactical Notes, questions answered, the Molasses Attack provides the strategy for a Klingon Victory, and a new sceanrio describes what would have happened if the Lyran attack of Y168 had not expanded into the General War.

140251.name: Line of Fire #12
boardgame: Nations at War: White Star Rising
World at War: Battles within Battles
World at War: Blood and Bridges
World at War: The Untold Stories
140251.description:
This issue is like no other before it. Not only does it contain the articles and scenarios you expect, but this issue includes Raid & Riposte, a Complete Game by Mark H. Walker. This issue also features A LOT of content on Forgotten Heroes Vietnam Second Edition:

A detailed review of the game, including an extensive example of play.
An in-depth historical article providing background for many of the scenarios.
An article on the American LRRPs.
And three new scenarios!

But it’s not just about Forgotten Heroes 2. The issue also includes:

Previews of Honneur et Patrie and Into the Breach.
Reviews of Band of Brothers and Singapore 1942.
A World at War HQ Variant.
An Interview with Space Infantry Designer Gottardo Zancani.
A White Star Rising scenario.
A World at War scenario that pits West German Recon elements (from the Compendium) against elements of the Soviet 93rd Recon (from Blood & Bridges) for the city of Bitterfeld (map from Battles within Battles).
A Solitaire World at War scenario depicts Soviet and East German forces attempting to quell the Polish Solidarity Movement in 1980 (uses components from The Untold Stories and Eisenbach Gap).
Part 1 (of 2) of a World at War Modulette on the Second Sino-Vietnamese Border War in 1985 (37 New Counters Included!; The Untold Stories required).
Plus Nicaraguans (New Counters Included) take on Americans in a Lock ‘n Load scenario based on events in the upcoming World at War module America Conquered.

140252.name: Line of Fire #7
boardgame: Lock 'n Load: Heroes of the Blitzkrieg
World at War: Blood and Bridges
140252.description:
Line of Fire #7 contains 40 fun-filled pages, including articles by Jeff Schulte on designing WaW scenarios and a recap of the 2009 WaW: Eisenbach Gap tournament at WBC.

It also contains:

An in-depth preview of LnL: Heroes of the Gap by Pete Abrams.
A Battle Report by Pete Atack on the Heroes of the Blitzkrieg scenario “Fighting the Hedgehogs.”
Interviews with game designer Brian Train (Summer Lightning) and with four of the artists that make LnLP’s game components and publications stand out from all the rest.
Five World at War scenarios and two Lock 'n Load scenarios, plus two new maps (one for each system).

140253.name: Munchkin Jolly Jumbo D6
140253.description:
From the publisher's website:
It's a Christmas 25mm die with classic John Kovalic Munchkin art!

(This is just the die with no promotion cards.)

140254.description:
From publisher's website:
We refuse to write a complex description for dice. These are 6-siders, and there are six in the package. They are the color of coffee with just enough cream, if you like too much cream in your coffee like SJ does. They have the Munchkin head in place of the 1. Buy them. Kill monsters and take their stuff.
140254.name: +6 Bag o' Munchkin d6

140255.description:
From the publisher:
All true munchkins know . . . part of the fun is gloating about how far ahead you are. With the Munchkin Gameboard, it's easy for everyone to see exactly where they are. Gloat at your impending victory, or curse the fates as your rivals move past you.
The board has rooms numbered 1 to 10; use your favorite miniatures or any other counters you like* to mark your progress through the dungeon. The first player to reach 10 is the winner!
It also has spaces for both decks and their discard piles.
140255.name: Munchkin Gameboard

140256.description:
From the publisher:
We refuse to write a complex description for dice. These are 6-siders, and there are six in the package. They match the pawns in the +6 Bag o' Munchkins and +6 Bag o' Munchkin Babes, and the dice in Munchkin Quest. They also match pretty rainbows. They have the Munchkin head in place of the 1. Buy them. Kill monsters and take their stuff.
140256.name: +6 Bag o' Munchkin Rainbow d6

bgaccessoryversion: Black with Light Blue Ink edition
W23 Munchkin Quest Jumbo D6 Bundle
140257.description:
From the publisher:

These super-sized 25mm 6-siders are Warehouse 23 exclusives, and they glow in the dark! The set includes two jumbo dice -- a "Munchkin d6" and a "Monster d6," with classic John Kovalic art on every face.

Similar to the standard Munchkin Jumbo D6, but with a whitish color that glows in the dark. Also, no cards are included with this version. Released in April 2011, a couple months prior to the other Jumbo d6s. Only available from the publisher's online store.

While no cards come with these dice, the publisher released a promo card called Ghost Hands, that specifically requires the glow-in-the-dark Jumbo d6 dice.
140257.name: Munchkin Jumbo D6

140259.description: Wooden tokens to replace the cards in Settlers of Catan. Contents includes 19 of each of 5 token sets: Wood, Sheep, Brick, Wheat, and Ore.
140259.name: Catan: Yucatan Wooden Token Set (95 Pack)

140260.description: Wooden tokens to replace the cards in Settlers of Catan & the 5-6 player expansion. Contents includes 25 of each of 5 token sets: Sheep, Grain, Brick, Wood and Ore.
140260.name: Catan: Yucatan Wooden Token Set (125 Tokens)

140261.description: A Feast for Crows is the second expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition). This four-player scenario includes setup instructions and adds house cards for House Arryn. Also introduced is a deck of Objective cards and four Special Objective cards, one for each House, that alter the way players score Victory Points.
140261.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition) – A Feast for Crows
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
boardgamefamily: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game

140262.name: Breakout 2000
140262.description:
Breakout 2000 is a 3-D version of the arcade classic designed for one or two players. There are a total of ten different phases to survive, each consisting of five playfields.

The game featured good and bad power-ups somewhat similar to Arkanoid. There were unbreakable bricks, multi-hit bricks and stacked bricks. Ball movement was limited to the lower level of stacked bricks so breaking a lower brick would allow the stacked bricks to fall into the now vacated location.

The game also featured a two player mode that allowed two people (or a person and the computer) to compete head to head. In this mode a player's ball could loop around to the other player's playfield and break the opponent's bricks. A 2X bonus was awarded for breaking your opponent's bricks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Breakout 2000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

The Breakout Barrage!

SMASH! POW! CRUNCH! Is your hand/eye coordination up to demolishing field after field of bricks? Breakout 2000 brings back the nostalgia of early gaming days but adds 90's challenges, such as a three-dimensional field and bricks that resist breaking, as well as many powerups and hazards. You can also test your skill against a buddy. Break through your own wall and start working on his. You'll gain bonus points, and he'll go nuts! Who ever said life was fair never played Breakout 2000.

140263.name: Dwellers in Dream
140263.description:
publisher blurb

Long have the fey captured mankind’s imaginations. Dwellers in Dream is a fey-themed player sourcebook containing five all-new races for the Pathfinder RPG. This new sourcebook explores five original fey-themed races for your d20 and Pathfinder games. These are not your standard fantasy fey either, these are creations from the darkest recesses of the twisted minds over at Total Party Kill Games.

The first of the five new player races is the Briarborn, a plant-like race born of nature’s response to harm and injury. They grow quickly and are a measured response to the likes of orcs and men who would seek to harm the world itself. Then there are the Crimbil, goblin-blooded fey and snatchers of children. Next, we explore the True Changelings, mercurial shape-shifting fey. There is also the Glimmerkin, a race of elves who used magic to enter a chrysalis state for an age and emerged something altogether different. Lastly is the Sylfaen, a brutal warden of nature and fey lands, the leaders of the Wyld Hunts.

Each race is fully developed with a total of 80 pages of content! There are tons of new fey-themed feats, abilities, traits, archetypes, spells, magical items and even a new plane of existence. All of the content is hyperlinked to the d20pfsrd.com website for your convenience of use and extensively bookmarked.

140264.name: Defender 2000
140264.description:
Defender 2000 is a game developed for the Atari Jaguar in 1995 by Jeff Minter. The game contains 3 modes of gameplay (Defender Classic, Defender Plus, and Defender 2000), as well 2 hidden mini-games: Flossie's Revenge & Plasma Pong.

Source: Wikipedia, "Defender 2000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

Will They Never Learn?

You whomped the aliens from the Alpha Proximian Empire in classic Defender and sent them home to cry. Now they want the planets that Earth is mining for desperately needed, life-sustaining minerals. Your job is to protect the space miners as they perform their vital work. The aliens will try to capture them and use their life-energy to turn their ships into hyper-fast mutants. Rescue the captives and destroy the aliens or Earth is history!

140265.description:
From Kickstarter Update #2

"These two tiles show the T-Rex and the Raptors at their most vicious, and are used for creating a more violent game where these two predators are more devastating:

1. The new Raptor Tile allows each Raptor, after it moves, to eat 2 Dinos and scatter 3 Dinos.

2. The new T-Rex Tile allows: 1) if T-Rex moves 1 area it eats 6 Dinos ; or 2) and if it moves 2 areas it eats 4 Dinos.

This makes each of the new tiles a bit stronger and perhaps more desirable to choose than before, but doesn’t imbalance the game play."
140265.name: Triassic Terror: Limited Edition Predator Tiles

140266.name: Missile Command 3D
140266.description:
Back of Box

Prepare For The Alien Attack!

Aliens are out to take over your colonies and it's up to you to stop them. You're armed with an arsenal of lasers, missiles and smart bombs, but it takes more than raw fire power to stop these guys. You've got to be quick and accurate to keep your cities from becoming alien neighborhoods. This Jaguar update of the arcade classic includes Original Missile Command, 3D Missile Command and Virtual Mission Command. Defend the cities from the relentless alien attack!

140267.name: Super Science
140267.description:
Back Cover

Alien life on other worlds. Technologies both terran and Alien. Galaxies and their Star Systems. All the traditional science fiction elements are now detailed in Super Science, the science fiction reule expansion for Super Squadron. When used in conjunction with the rules already published in Super Squadron, The Games Master can now generate aliens, their home planets and their civilization (technology) levels. Super Science can be used as a science fiction game itself or to provide exotic locales for your Super Squadron players to adventure in.

140268.name: The Tome
140268.description:
Back cover

The Tome is the first Super Squadron Adventure Book. It contains ten fully detailed and exciting scenarios certain to challenge even the most capable of superbeings. Each scenario is completee in itself, and contains a number of encounters that can be played consecutively, or worked into an existing campaign, as desired. Comprehensive maps are provided for all relevant encounters. Inside the Tome, you will find reusable statistics for both goons and normal people, and many examples of NPC superbeings (several of which have variants powers). Also included within are many new rule additions, including 11 power expansions and 22 new and revised spells.

140269.name: K-Razy Shoot-Out
140269.description:
Back of Box

Evil Alien Droids have you surrounded! Blast through them and escape their deadly Control Sectors!

Trapped within deadly Alien Control Sectors, your squad of Space Commanders must shoot it out with dangerous Alien Droids in order to survive. Only your keen reflexes and trusty laser pistol stand in the way of your total annihilation! You'll have to be sharp, though. Droids lurk behind every corner of each randomly generated Sector, and all of them must be destroyed before you can make a break into a more challenging maze! And watch out for the walls! They're radioactive. The slightest contact will quickly turn you into a cloud of debris.

Can you escape and make it to the rank of Marksman? Or are you fated to remain a Space Goon? Good luck, Commander!

140270.name: Zero 5
140270.description:
Back of Jaguar Box

Zero 5 is a futuristic space shooter set in a 3-D, 360 degree playfield. The year is 2044 and the battle for Earth has begun. On the far reaches of the galaxy, a massive invasion force is assembling. Scanners at DEFCON have alerted you to the alien threat. The Earth's best pilots are dispatched in their BAMBAM cruisers to engage the enemy.

Multiple weapons, driving soundtrack, non-stop combat, multiple power-ups, and 15 extended missions contribute to a shooters game with real depth.

140271.description:
Maximum Throwdown pits up to six players against one another in a battle royale of card-throwing action.

Each player has an individual deck of cards, and they take turns throwing the cards onto a shared playing area to try to cover up the icons of opponents' cards while keeping their own icons visible. On each turn, you draw one card from your deck and throw one card – but if you have the right icons in play, you'll draw more cards, throw more cards, steal cards from opponents and dump them in the gutter, break free of the shared playing space in order to keep from being covered, and – perhaps most important of all – score points each turn you have enough visible icons in play. After all the cards have been tossed, whoever has the most points wins!
140271.name: Maximum Throwdown
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 79-- Interviews Galore, some MDM, and John Cusack Top 3 Bum 1
Strange Assembly 103 - Well Played

140272.name: Public Playtest Package (2013-03-20)
rpg: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)
140272.description:
User summary:

The March 20th playtest package contains substantial revisions across the board, and introduces the druid, paladin and ranger classes for the first time.

This playtest packet included:


A "Read First" document (3 pages)
A How To Play guide (25 pages)
A Creating a Character guide (5 pages)
A Classes guide (49 pages)
A Races guide (8 pages)
A Backgrounds and Skills guide (6 pages)
A Specialties and Feats guide (14 pages)
A Spells guide (50 pages)
An Equipment guide (11 pages)
A DM Guidelines guide (23 pages)
A Bestiary (91 pages)
A Magic Items guide (31 pages)
Six pre-generated character sheets (10 pages)
A blank character sheet (2 pages)
An adventure, Caves of Chaos (23 pages)
An adventure, Reclaiming Blingdenstone (40 pages)
An adventure, Isle of Dread (44 pages)
An adventure, The Mud Sorcerer's Tomb (34 pages)
Adventure conversion notes for Against the Cult of Chaos (19 pages)
Adventure conversion notes for Storm over Neverwinter (21 pages)

140273.name: Mekton
140273.description:
from the back cover

"Mekton is the complete system for giant Japanese Robot Combat and roleplaying"

140274.name: Unity of Command: Red Turn
140274.description:
The dying days of the Stalingrad Campaign saw the Wehrmacht reeling under heavy blows. The battle of Kursk will now see them pursue an offensive agenda for one last time. Soon after, as the strategic initiative swings in favor of the Soviets, you are tasked with liberating the motherland in command of victorious Red Army forces.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140275.name: Galipotes
140275.description:
There's commotion in the village! The legendary Galipote, who, years ago, terrorized walkers in the west of France, has been seen at night, hidden behind the old oak tree : giant eyes, large jaws and big claws, of either green, yellow or red color.

At the beginning of each round, each player start with a hand of 7 Galipote cards.

During his turn, a player can places one of his card as Testimonial, on one of the 6 available sides, matching half-symbols and colors. If there is a Legend card available, he can places up to 2 cards according to the Legend. If he places a card with fur on the side, other players vote for the new Legend card. If he complete the Figure of Galipotes in one side (a symbol), he can score the cards for him.

The first player to get rid of all his cards, there is one turn until the end the game.

He scores as positive points all the remaining cards in players hand. Other players scores as negatives points all their cards in hand. All players scores as positive points the number of different colors of the Figure of Galipote, for each symbol.

140276.name: Goodfolks
140276.description:
Will you accept the challenge of bringing an abandoned village back to life? Goodfolks are coming to this country looking for a nice place to live and work. You are going to build fields, orchards, and livestock corrals and help them organize their work. You can have various farm animals producing eggs, milk, wool, and manure. Restore the village and its surroundings and collect all the animal breeds!

Source: The Game Website.

140277.name: Prima Klima
140277.description:
Objective: get most event/action cards; learn more about communication/environment;
- acting by turns/simultaneously -
shuffle 2 green, 4 red, 6 orange, 8 blue event/chance cards forming a pile;
create your world by assembling carton pads with a disc/placing 6 'weather' tiles upon the disc; at last fix all together with a rubber band building a tension
active player draws top card, depending on colour you have to solve a question (multiple choice), increase/decrease tension (rubber band), solve calamities (dropped weather tiles); if you are succeeding get corresponding event card...

140278.name: SolForge
140278.description:
(The game has been released and is available for free to download online.)

The creators of Ascension and Magic: The Gathering have joined forces to create a revolutionary digital trading card game -- SolForge combines the strategy and depth of a traditional trading card game experience with the convenience of online and mobile gaming. Players will be able to experience Solforge absolutely free and can grow their collection just by playing the game.

You construct your play deck before hand, but your hand cycles through, more similar to a deck building game. SolForge is differentiated in that every time you play a creature, its leveled up version also goes into your discard pile. Since you typically play two out of five cards per turn, this adds some subtlety to what you play.

SolForge currently supports building your own decks to play against your friends, compete in online tournaments, and automatching with players. Future development will allow you to explore a rich fantasy world in a single-player campaign mode in which your actions can affect the direction of the story.

SolForge is a free-to-play digital collectable strategy game that combines all the depth of a traditional trading card game experience with the convenience of online and mobile gaming. In SolForge, you take on the role of a Forgeborn, one of the select few who can wield the magic of the SolForge itself. You collect cards and use them to construct decks with ferocious creatures, imposing structures, and powerful spells to battle AI opponents in the single-player campaign mode or test your skills against other players in the arena.

The goal of a game of SolForge is to reduce your opponent’s health from one hundred to zero. How you do this - whether by attacking quickly with a swarm of creatures or playing defense until you have a single unstoppable monster - is really up to you.

Source: The Game Website.

140279.description:
Clacks: A Discworld Board Game is based on the "Clacks" semaphore messaging system — the fastest (non-magical) messaging system on the Discworld — featured in Sir Terry Pratchett's novel Going Postal.

Using a semaphore system of shuttered lamps on top of high towers, the Grand Trunk Semaphore Company has revolutionized long-distance communications on the Discworld. Their network of towers covers most of the Unnamed Continent, but now the old postal service is fighting back. Driven by the determination of newly "volunteered" Post Master Moist Von Lipwig, the Ankh-Morpork Post Office has challenged the Clacks operators to a race from Ankh-Morpork to Genua.

Play against your friends and claim the title of Fastest Clacks Operator on the line, or play together as a team to win the race across the Discworld and prove that Clacks is here to stay. In more detail, Clacks: A Discworld Board Game contains rules for a player vs. player game, a co-operative race game against the Post Office, and a children's introductory game.
140279.name: Clacks: A Discworld Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Smorgasboard, smorgasboard - Episode 15
The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016

140280.name: Die Thüringen-Reise
140280.description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Gotha, Thuringia; learn more about Thuringia.
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions
remarks:
published before or during WWII

140281.name: Brain Assist
140281.description:
Brain Assist or Touch de Uno DS is a puzzle video game released for Nintendo DS in Japan, North America, and the PAL region. Studies in the 1960s demonstrated the lateralization of brain function. The left-brain hemisphere deals with sequential analysis - reasoning using language, mathematics, abstraction and reasoning. Memory is primarily stored in a language format. The right hemisphere deals with auditory, visual, and spatial concepts (art, for example) dancing and gymnastics. There is an overlap, though. Brain Assist for the Nintendo DS aims to stimulate your right brain.

Source: Wikipedia, "Brain Assist", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140282.name: The Red Menace
140282.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2012, Polish RPG publisher Gramel released their licensed version of Adamant Entertainment's Savage Worlds core book, THRILLING TALES 2nd Edition. Within it's pages was an additional chapter, exclusive to the Polish edition, detailing the use of the Soviets as villains for pulp adventures.

Now, for the first time in English, this additional material is being made available as bonus content for THRILLING TALES campaigns!

Pulp Villains: The Red Menace details the history of the Soviet Union from the Revolution until the pulp era of the 1930s, and features a collection of Soviet NPC archetypes from the Red Army to Dastardly Spies. Russian weapons of the 1930s are also detailed, as well as a section of suggestions for pulp plots featuring the Red Menace!

140283.name: Lights, Camera, MURDER!
140283.description:
From publisher blurb:

An old friend invites the heroes to be extras in the next Buck Corgan Western serial -- action and suspense quickly turns to horror and murder when the dark shadow of ancient evil falls across the silver screen!

Lights, Camera MURDER! is an adventure designed for four to six Seasoned characters, three to four Veteran characters, or a Legendary hero and his assistants. It uses the Savage Worlds rules system, as featured in THRILLING TALES 2nd Edition.

140284.name: Towers II: Plight of the Stargazer
140284.description:
Back of Box

Finally, a genuine RPG for Jaguar.

Become one of four different characters as you are immersed within the strange happenings in the mystical land of Lamini. You must uncover the secrets as you explore Daggan's tower. Many before you have tried, but none have returned.

First person perspective, full screen smooth scrolling, talk to others, refer to maps, collect 100's of items, encounter 100's of creatures, experience challenges in combat and spell casting.

Hours and hours of entertainment with appropriate save features.

140285.name: Flip Out! (1995)
140285.description:
Back of Box

ALIEN ENCOUNTERS OF A FLIPPING KIND

Congratulations Earthling! The Citizens of Planet Phrohmaj have invited you to join their Great Tile Flipping Festival, an honor of the highest sort. Tile flipping influences their customs, their eating habits, and even their vacations. Solve maddening puzzles while watching for the mischievous aliens who think confusing you is part of the fun. If they weren't so cute you'd wring their necks...if they had them.


Nine wacky areas with multiple games in each area
Four difficulty levels from Normal to Psychotic
Twelve kinds of crazy aliens

140286.name: Raiden
140286.description:
In the year 2090, Earth has suddenly become the target of deranged aliens known as the Cranassians. Following the invasion, the World Alliance Military builds a new cutting-edge weapon, the Raiden Supersonic Attack Fighter. Based on a captured alien craft, it is humanity's only hope for survival.

Raiden is a scrolling shooter arcade game that was developed by Seibu Kaihatsu. The title is in Japanese and means "Thunder And Lightning". In September 1990, Raiden hit the top of the arcade game popularity charts. The game was on the charts for over 38 months, including 26 months in the top ten. Due to the success of Raiden, several sequels and related games were made.

Raiden consists of eight vertical scrolling missions where the player maneuvers the Raiden craft dodging and destroying enemy robots, buildings, ground targets, and aircraft. There are bombs and missile powerups as well as collectable medals which add to the score. When the player dies, the fighter's fragments become projectiles that damage enemies.

After defeating the Stage 8 boss, the mission is completed and the player receives 1 million points. Following Stage 8 the game reverts to Stage 1. However, this time around the enemy shots travel faster and are fired at a more rapid rate.

Raiden was ported to the FM Towns Marty, PC Engine, Atari Jaguar, Atari Lynx, Amiga (unreleased prototype) and MS-DOS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Raiden (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140287.name: Supercross 3D
140287.description:
Back of Box

Smell the Dirt!

Five...four...three...two...one... Go for it! Jump off the start and go freight training into the first corner with seven other riders. Try to do nac nacs and one handers off the jumps to grab the crowd's attention. If you're up for shooting the curves and hitting the whoops full speed ahead, you could be championship material. Practice hard enough, and you could find yourself leading the pack on the Supercross tournament circuit.

140288.name: Ruta
140288.description:
A Decktet game for two players, in which you are a merchant attempting to claim as many trade routes throughout the kingdom as you can.

Ruta is a game of card drafting and network building, inspired by the popular game Ticket to Ride. A 5x3 grid of cards is used to represent the people and places with which players are trying to establish trade routes. Players take turns drawing cards and playing those cards to claim routes (orthogonal connections between adjacent cards on the map). Tokens are used to mark each player's routes.

Points are awarded for each route that is claimed, and players earn bonus points for their longest continuous route. When one player is out of tokens, the game ends, and the player with the most points wins.

This game requires a Decktet extended deck and 20 tokens in 2 colors (10 of each color). Suit chips may be used.

140289.name: Hover Strike
140289.description:
Hover Strike is a hovercraft combat game set in the far future. It began as an update to the classic arcade game Battlezone, but was renamed when it drifted from the source material. The game allows you to shoot your way through 30 different 3D levels which include terrain like ice, water, mountains. Your weaponry includes guided missiles, missiles, grenades and lasers.

Most of the enemies in the game are low flying aircraft that follow and shoot at the player's hovercraft. There are also turrets and enemy hovercrafts that are on the battlefield. Most of the missions order you to take out a certain number of enemy rockets, sensors, or re-spawning bases.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hover Strike", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

THE ULTIMATE WAR MACHINE IS HERE!

You fear the worst for the missing colonists. Terrakian Pirates have taken over the distant planet, with their deadly machines patrolling every section of the surface.

The Federation has chosen you to launch a preemptive strike. Your vehicle is a state-of-the-art armored hovercraft, equipped with rapid fire cannon and powerful missiles. Anti-grav units enable it to float over any terrain. Battle through 30 fully texture-mapped 3D levels, including Night Vision missions. Knock out key targets and make way for the Federation armada. Save the colony before it's too late!

140290.name: Deep Where the Liche-Lord Lies: A Descent into Horror
140290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beneath an ancient mausoleum, deep within the Forest of Maugaral, there is a mighty dungeon; a stronghold of goblins, ogres, and worse. At its deepest point, surrounded by earthly riches, lies the tomb of Vasarax, an ancient and malignant sorcerer. Though entombed for centuries, stories abound that the long dead mage has arisen as a powerful Liche-Lord. It is said that whoever steps foot into his resting chamber will instantly perish...

Deep Where the Liche-Lord Lies: A Descent into Horror is a huge, multi-level GM adventure for Tunnels & Trolls, compatible with 5th or 7th edition rules. It is a tough dungeon that will test even the strongest of parties as they penetrate deeper into its gloomy depths. Everything a GM requires to run what would amount to a mini campaign can be found within its pages, including detailed maps of each level and the surrounding terrain, plus descriptions of all of the rooms and contents. This is the largest GM module ever produced for T&T from the master of gothic horror adventures, Andy Holmes.

140291.name: Formication
140291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Formication is a mini solitaire adventure for use with the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing system created by Ken St.Andre. It has been designed for use with version 7.5 of the rules but could easily be adapted for use with earlier editions.

You are a newly commissioned officer in the Royal Guard of the fairy kingdom of Cerinor. Captured by your sworn enemy,the batkin hordes of the Marble Mountains, you have been sent into a nest of giant fire ants to retrieve ant larvae for the delectation of the batkin hierarchy. Can you survive in the claustrophobic confines of the ant colony long enough to be able to attempt to escape or will the creatures of entomological nightmare within put an end to your adventures for good?

This adventure is designed for a newly created fairy warrior of 1st or 2nd level.

140292.description:
Requiem is a miniatures expansion of the game "Empire of the Dead", a whole host of new characters, and ingenious steampunk machines, from Victorian fiction.

The game is set in an age where a steampunk victorian empire rules the world. An empire fueled by an extraordinary discovery. The mineral that has become known as infernium. But all is not well, dark shadows from our deepest nightmares stalk the smog shrouded streets of London. An ancient evil is rising from defeat.

Players choose from 4 starter factions which they can expand and add to from a range of special character models. Each game is played over several turns, each turn consisting of four distinct phases (maintenance, initiative, activation and combat).

The expansion, Requiem, adds 70 new characters to the original game and introduces new factions like the Clickers (a race of automata) or the Supernatural Branch (new character types, weapons and machines used by Scotland Yards Occult Police force) and also the rules covering the new Victorian Machines.
140292.name: Empire of the Dead: Requiem
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 103 - Empire of the Dead
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 145 - West Wind Prodctions

140293.name: Rapscallion
140293.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have always sacrificed a little of your hard-won gold to Ylsenor, the god of the rogues. In return, you have enjoyed more than your fair share of good fortune. Today, just as you think your luck has finally run out, your deity snatches you from death's jaws, but now you are expected to entertain the great Dissembler. Take on his challenge, and prove his faith in you is well founded, and the rewards may be great. Fail him, and you may never have the opportunity to pay homage to him again...

Rapscallion is a solitaire Adventure module for play with Tunnels & Trolls. Any Rogue character of 1st to 3rd level may explore its 142 adventure paragraphs. It has been written with the 7th/7.5th Edition of the Rule Book in mind, though it will adapt to earlier Editions.

140294.name: Soul Survivor
140294.description:
From publisher blurb:

Soul Survivor is a mini solitaire adventure for use with the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing system created by Ken St.Andre. It has been designed for use with version 7.5 of the rules but could easily be adapted for use with earlier editions.

Within its 91 adventure paragraphs your character engages in a race to escape from a nether world on the edge of reality where the demon Prince Baclitax'l and his fiendish hordes hold sway. At stake is your very soul.

This adventure first appeared in Trollszine #6. It has been slightly expanded and updated for this free Tavernmaster Games edition.

140295.name: The Tavern by the Sea (UK)
140295.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tavern by the Sea, by Ken St Andre and Andy R Holmes, is a mini solitaire adventure for use with the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing system.It has been designed for use with version 7.5 of the rules but could be adapted for use with earlier editions. Because this is a Mini-Solo Dungeon, no acts of magic will be allowed by the players -- don't use wizards in this scenario. You may use any humanoid (except Fairies or Giants) of 3rd level or lower, but this is a good opportunity to create a new character at the start of this adventure."

A hundred miles south of Knor lies the fishing village of Frargg, home to the infamous Seven Ayes Tavern. The Seven Ayes has become synonymous with all manner of seaside tavern life including brawling, sea shanties, gambling, ruffians and pirates. It is also a good place for adventures to begin, and to end. Step inside, where your next adventure awaits, but tread with care my friend, as danger lurks within and death could be just a moment away…

This special UK version of this solo features additional material as well as completely new artwork by Jeff Freels.

140296.name: Prison Architect
videogameexpansion: Prison Architect - All Day and a Night
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Winner
2014 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best British Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Persistent Game of the Year Winner
140296.description:
Prison Architect is a video game by the British software company Introversion Software. It was made available as a paid alpha pre-order 26 September 2012 with updates scheduled every three to four weeks. The game was an entrant in the 2012 Independent Games Festival.

The game is a top down construction and management simulation where the player takes control of the running and building of a maximum security prison. The player is responsible for managing various aspects of their prison including staff, building new cells, finance, and keeping their inmates happy. The player's role is of both architect and governor with sandbox micromanagement themes such as choosing where to put lights, drains and how they connect together.

Source: Wikipedia, "Prison Architect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140297.name: Dawning
140297.description:
User Summary

Dawning is a unique platform game where you control a character who wakes up in a bed in the forest and then goes for a walk. What you find in your exploration might surprise you, and might even shock you, but it will certainly be unexpected.

140298.name: Marvin's Mittens
140298.description:
Yahoo!!

Marvin's Mittens is a 2D platformer with a focus on exploration and collection. With gorgeous, hand drawn art, Marvin presents a soothing world to explore, free from enemies and danger. Collect magic snowflakes to increase your jump height and race your sled across the landscape to reach new areas before your mother calls you back home. Learn the secrets of snow elf magic and traverse the world beyond Marvin's backyard to solve the mystery of the missing mitten. Immerse yourself in this charming indie title!

Key Features:

- Beautiful winter landscapes and charming characters
- Carefully placed collectibles encourage exploration and revisiting of levels
- Ever-increasing jump allows access to new parts of the world
- Coast down hills on your sled, find jumps to reach new areas
- Nearly an hour of beautiful original music
- Find shortcuts to venture further before Marvin is called back home by his mom
- Sneak up on wildlife to add animals to Marvin's sketchbook

Source: The Developer Website.

140299.name: The Ship of Fools
140299.description:
From the back of the book:

"A strange seaborne adventure designed for the Pathfinder RPG, with scaling options for 4-6 characters of 5th-7th level.

Welcome to the weather-beaten deck of the Green Lady, a galleon adrift on the blue-green waves... but where is her crew? Where is her legendary captain, the self-exiled wizard, Vossian the Green? Set sail 'lubbers and find out in this, our very latest Grave Undertaking starring your characters as the daring scallywags destined to solve the mystery of The Ship of Fools. You're sure to enjoy this excellently weird horror-trip written especially for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and delivered in true TPK Games fashion. Brave deadly zombies, mind-control slimes, suicidal haunts, sharks, swarms of eels and maybe your own crew (!) amongst other delightful deadlies in this rollicking good time!"

140300.name: Fairyland
140300.description:
Publisher blurb:

In an isolated village in the Scottish Borders, a young girl disappears every three years. Several days later, the girls return, emotionless, analytical and supremely intelligent.

But the locals have an explanation. The children were taken into Hobs Wood, with its dancing lights and shifting pathways. They were taken to Fairyland.

Fairyland is a scenario by Scott Dorward, for any Cthulhu system. It contains the rules of Cthulhu Dark, a rules-light Cthulhu game, which you can use to play Fairyland immediately.

140303.name: Bloodlines
140303.description:
It’s an age of kings and kingdoms, heirs and assassinations. You and your opponents are vying for control over the four royal bloodlines. To emerge the victor, you must carefully manage a mismatched court of nobles to create the most prestigious kingdom the world has ever seen.

Bloodlines is a micro game using 20 playing cards and 5 cubes. Each player drafts a hand of cards, each of which has a special ability and a point value that contributes to your influence in that suit's bloodline. Once all cards have been played, the prestige of any lines you control is based on presence of cards of that type in your opponent’s kingdoms.

Each card you play has an associated special ability, and that card remains in your Kingdom as influence in that bloodline. The card abilities are:


Ace (1 Influence): The Assassin may eliminate any unprotected card from the game, including any heirs placed on the card.
10 (2 Influence): The Castle protects all of the played cards in your kingdom from the effects of the Assassin and the Jack.
Jack (3 Influence): The Jack may swap any two unprotected played cards of equal Influence value. You may swap for a lower valued card if swapping from your own kingdom.
Queen (4 Influence): The Queen may produce an heir on any card you have played, including herself and cards in Castles. The heir increases this cards influence in that bloodline by 1.
King (5 Influence): The King has no ability, but he may be played directly into an empty Castle already in your Kingdom.


Full Rules available in the files section below

140304.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 8 - Dec 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Alternative Darstellung von Engeln oder: Haben alle Engel weiße Flügel?
Die Chroniken der Engel - Ein Universum geht zuende
Die Hölle, das sind die anderen
Ein Dutzend Segen, ein Dutzend Flüche
Geisterjäger John Sinclair 3 - Das Erbe des Templers
Im Wandel der Zeiten - Das Würfelspiel: Bronzezeit
Von Stein und Erz - Im Gespräch mit Bernard Craw
[Des Teufels Herde] Eine Inspiration zur Verwendung mit Western-Systemen wie Deadlands
[Die spitze Feder] Willst du's nett oder ehrlich?
140304.description: Issue 8 (marked 4.1 on the cover) deals with angels and demons.

rpg: Peryton Fantasy Role-Playing Game (Original and Revised Editions)
140305.name: Snow
140305.description:
From publisher blurb:

Those who who squint long enough through Mount Irem's blinding snow storms can see lights flickering high on its slopes. The people in the town below tell stories of a castle made of ice that glimmers at the high end of Tharg's run, but, when the weather is clear, no trace of it can ever be found. If it exists at all, it seems to exist only in the storm.

Snow is designed specifically for 5th - 7th level parties (depending on group size, magic items, all that) in Peryton RPG, Basic Fantasy RPG, and Labyrinth Lord, and should be easy to adapt to similar systems. Stats are also provided for Tunnels and Trolls. The T&T monster ratings in this adventure mostly range from 50 - 150. (Note for T&T players: several of the encounter tables use dice other than six-siders.)

Includes several new monsters and unique hazards in addition to the main scenario.

140306.name: Pille ja Palle Veeohutusmäng
140306.description:
Simple board game for children about water safety.

Players roll the dice and move on the board. There are many special squares on the track to move forward or backward, miss the turn or answer the simple questions how to act safely near the water. Who finishes first is the winner.

140307.name: Haunting At Rybalka Lodge
140307.description:
Publisher Description:

A 3.5/Pathfinder compatible adventure for 4-6 PCs of Levels 7-9

With royalty coming to town, the reopening of the new Rybalka Lodge couldn’t be timelier. Although the place is warm and inviting during the day, it becomes a different place at night. Locals refuse to approach Rybalka Lodge and the owner is fire-fighting rumors of it being haunted.

The original lodge burned down just one year ago, possibly by Vikmordere arsonists, and killed the visiting Ambassador Valdritch with his entire retinue. Now with the imminent arrival of a Klavekian Prince on the anniversary of the tragedy has stirred up both memories of the fire and the spirits of those consumed in the flames.

Can the party get to the bottom of what is going on before the prince sets foot in town? Will the spirits of those who suffered from the arsonists attack get their revenge? Will the Vikmordere try to instigate another assassination attempt? And who is the mysterious woman occasionally seen in the shadows around the new lodge?

140308.name: Logic Levels
140308.description:
Back of Box

It's an amazing maze with prizes everywhere. Plan your best path, and start the ball rolling!

If you like mazes, you'll love LOGIC LEVELS.

First you tell the Magic Hand where to put the walls, bridges and springs to guide the ball through the maze. The more prizes it hits the more points you will score.

But that's just the beginning. Once the ball starts rolling, you can change the maze as you go. Move the bridges back and forth. Send the walls up and down. Aim for a spring and KABOING!--up you go to a higher floor. Land in a paint bucket and KERPLOP!--the ball changes to a new color. Then hit a prize of the same color and you score extra points.

In LOGIC LEVELS you have to think fast--and that's why the fun will last and last.

LOGIC LEVELS was designed by Frieda Lekkerkerker.

Learning Value: Thinking logically and planning ahead are important steps in learning. LOGIC LEVELS challenges children to predict the outcome of a complex sequence of actions. It also encourages quick decision-making. Ages 7-12

140309.name: Black Plague Blind Date
140309.description:
Dating is hard in the 14th century, and as a matchmaker, business is slim. The plague has most folks too afraid to leave their homes, let alone go out looking for romance. Literacy is very low, so the letters you receive from clients are oftten difficult to make out. To make matters worse, you're not the only match-maker in town.

To come out on top of your rival matchmakers you will have to go with what little information you can decipher and find matches for your clients. At times it will be in your best interest you to work with your opponents, at others it will benefit you to set devious traps for them.

Love is in the air! But so is the plague...

In Black Plague Blind Date, players take turns choosing a card from their hands to play face down as a "blind date". They then must truthfully describe their card with 1-3 colored "info cubes" (blue = male, pink = female, black = infected, white = healthy, green = high class, brown = low class). Cards change hands during the exchange phase, then each player plays a second card face up next to any blind date. Blind dates are revealed and reputation points are scored based upon the best/worst dates. Matching two healthy townsfolk or two plague-ridden citizens will earn you points, but don't accidentally cross the two and spread the plague! The game is played over 4 "seasons" (rounds) with each season affecting scoring in a significant way. It's a quick-playing game of deduction and bluffing for 3-4 players.

Full rules are available under the Files section of this entry.


Black Plague Blind Date won the February 2013 Boardroomers Game Design Contest in the 3+ Players category. Entrants in the contest were limited to using no more than 20 standard playing cards and 10 cubes.

140310.name: Othello (Atari 2600)
140310.description:
User Summary

A computerized implementation of the board game Reversi. You can play against the computer or a friend.

140311.description:
The Questor Expansion adds components for a fifth player, as well as a compass token to Questor. The fifth player will play as the Psionic Prisoner, whose goal and ability are just as unique as the other characters': The Psionic Prisoner merely must escape the dungeon through one of the four exits. The challenge is that the way the Psionic Prisoner deals with monsters is by retreating from them, and when he is in the game, he starts in the middle space, with monsters guaranteed in the surrounding four spaces. So, he can't move until another character liberates him. Fortunately, the Psionic Prisoner has the option to rotate any revealed room 90°, rather than move or dig.

Because the Psionic prisoner is one more character the Healer must heal, this expansion includes a white disc. The compass token included with the expansion is a fancy-looking way to track one of the losing conditions of the cooperative / solitaire game.
140311.name: Questor Expansion

140312.name: Elite: Station Run
140312.description:
From the Website:

"Station Run is a board game version of the computer game Elite, released by Ian Bell and David Braben in the mid 80s.

You and some other players need to get from one end of the game board to the other without your ship being destroyed. Other players might do it, or some of the random people who ply the spacelanes might get to you first.

Station Run is a free-to-download game. No need to whip out the credit card for this one, and no need to try and remember your paypal password."

From the free PDF rules:

"Station Run is a game for one to four players. Each player is the pilot of a ship which has just hyperspaced into the system. They must get to the nearby planet’s space station in order to sell cargo, refuel or whatever else they might want to do. The player can take on a number of roles. Traders are ferrying cargo between systems to make profit, which they can use to improve their ship or buy another one. Bounty Hunters are seeking out wrongdoers and bringing them to justice. Pirates are only interested in plundering the traders and stealing their cargo. Miners are looking for asteroids to mine for valuable minerals.

The aim of the game is to get from one end of the game board to the other in one piece. Random encounters may occur, as other spacefarers and asteroids make their way around the planet’s
orbitspace. The game is designed to be open-ended and as freeform as possible (just like the computer game)."

140313.name: NASCAR 99
140313.description:
NASCAR 99 is a racing simulator video game game developed and published by EA Sports and co-developed by Stormfront Studios. Released for Nintendo 64 and PlayStation, it was the second game in the EA Sports NASCAR series of video games.

NASCAR 99 received mixed reviews upon its release. The game was praised for its realistic graphics regarding the cars, although critics felt that the other graphics were "lacking". Also, critics stated that the game was "repetitive and boring", mainly because of the 17 tracks included in the game, only 2 are road-courses (Watkins Glen and Sears Point), and the rest are a mix of ovals, tri-ovals, quad ovals, and short tracks, which accurately reflected the mix of real life NASCAR tracks.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR 99", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140314.description:
High Heavens sets the players in the clouds, fighting for ultimate power above the earth.

High Heavens is a two player, tactical strategy game played on a hex grid, pitting Norse gods against Greek gods. The game is won when either all 12 gods in an entire pantheon is wiped out, or when Asgard or Mt. Olympus is destroyed. Players draw five cards every turn and then are allowed 3 actions. These actions can include Invoking a god, Moving, Attacking, playing a Divine Power card, using a god's Special Ability or Acquiring a dropped bonus chip. Red chips are stacked under each character to represent that characters health. Modifiers such as Attack Bonus, Armor, or Disabled are also represented by different colored chips. No two gods are alike, and their actions and abilities closely correlate to the mythology they were derived from. The luck of the cards you draw forces you to change your strategy from game to game. There is no reshuffling when you are out of cards, so once a god is dead, they're dead. Game play takes about a half an hour to an hour, depending on the players' skill, luck of the draw and the strategies used.

Created by award-winning video game industry veteran Ryan Lesser (Guitar Hero, Rock Band, Beatles:Rock Band, Dance Central...), High Heavens is a 2-player, expandable board game that utilizes lessons learned from 15 years of video game creation and a lifetime of playing board games.
140314.name: High Heavens
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episide 17: Bonsai!
Favorite Games of 2015
High Heavens
The Rebellion

140315.name: Monopoly: The Beatles Yellow Submarine
140315.description:
ALL ABOARD THE YELLOW SUBMARINE!

Travel 80,000 leagues under the sea to the unearthly paradise known as Pepperland in this colorful Yellow Submarine edition of MONOPOLY. All you need is love to help The Beatles battle the Blue Meanies as you buy, sell and trade your way through the Sea of Science, the Headlands, Nowhere Land, the Sea of Holes and more.

Ad hoc, ad loc, and quid pro quo! So little time! Advance to Go!

Monopoly, the classic game of property trading with a Beatles theme.

Game includes 6 collectible pewter tokens; Yellow Submarine, Dreadful Flying Glove, Jeremy Hillary Boob, Love Sign, Sgt. Pepper Drum, Old Fred

140316.name: Wayne Gretzky's 3D Hockey 98
140316.description:
Wayne Gretzky's 3D Hockey '98 is an ice hockey game for the Nintendo 64 and PlayStation. The game is endorsed by hockey star, Wayne Gretzky and is the sequel to Wayne Gretzky's 3D Hockey. The game gained widespread criticism for several perceived shortcomings, including being unfit as a pure hockey simulator. This left many simulation enthusiasts disappointed, but many arcade fans delighted.

Gameplay consists of two basic options: Arcade and Simulation. Players have the ability to customize period length, camera angle, line changes, penalties and rink size. In addition, fatigue, fighting and puck-streak can be toggled on or off.

Simulation Mode

Simulation mode is designed to emulate the real game of hockey. Players may play five, four, or three to a side, depending on preference. Recognition of penalties, off-sides, and icing are all optional, but two-line pass is not considered. Period length can be selected between 5, 10, 15, and 20 minutes.

Arcade Mode

In Arcade mode checking, hooking, and tripping are more violent. Fights occur with greater frequency, and penalties are disregarded entirely. Additionally, players may utilize a "power shot" which lights the net on fire when a goal is scored. As a resule of these changes, the Arcade mode tends to be more exciting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wayne Gretzky's 3D Hockey '98", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140317.name: Monopoly: Adventure Time Collector's Edition
140317.description:
WHAT TIME IS IT?

Join best buds and top notch adventurers Finn and Jake on a journey to claim the Land of Ooo and beyond with the Adventure Time Collector's Edition of MONOPOLY. Embark to the sweet and sugary Candy Kingdom, hide your wallet in the City of Thieves and travel to alternate dimensions like the demonic wasteland of the Nightosphere or even Lumpy Space! Fortune and glory await, but beware! The path is perilous as the Ice King, the Lich and a bunch other evil dudes are waiting to jack you up. Winner is the cool guy!

Monopoly the classic game of property trading themed to the world of everyone's favorite friends Adventure Time.

Includes 6 custom tokens: Ice King's Crown, Princess Bubblegum, Jake, Finn, Lumpy Space Princess, Tree Trunks

140318.name: Time Fcuk
140318.description:
User Summary

Time Fcuk is a puzzle platform game by Edmund McMillen which focuses heavily on the puzzle aspect. The title and ambiance are meant to illustrate the confusion you will have as you need to twist your brain around to solve the various puzzles.

Time Fcuk is a black & white flash game that is free to play on a web browser or can now be purchased as part of the Basement Collection.

A wonderful synopsis can be found on Edmund McMillen's blog.

140319.name: Ischadra, Grandmother of Assassins
140319.description:
publisher blurb

ISCHADRA, GRANDMOTHER OF ASSASSINS - CR 14, Advanced Soulbound Doll Assassin 10/Inquisitor 2

A horrifying new Infamous Adversary for the Pathfinder RPG!
She wears the guise of a doll, a child-like construct of porcelain and wire, but cold sentience seemingly teems in her empty eye sockets. She stares with an eery mute silence, giving you a moment for your brain to adjust to what it is seeing. A doll given life, bestowed with an ancient weapon of vengeance and purpose. With an inhuman leap her blade buries deep in your throat. As the last of your lifeblood spills her words take form in your mind, and you know why the Grandmother of Assassins has come.
Infamous Adversaries contains: one ready to use villain, complete with equipment, a rich background including motives, history, personality, network, resources, lair, tactics, morale, advancement options, a quote, plot hooks to easily insert them into your campaign, local lore, full color art and a vibrant description. The Infamous Adversaries characters are designed to challenge an entire party; not just in combat, but also through less direct methods requiring careful planning and confrontation.
Contained within is 26 pages of original TPK content including a full depiction of our Infamous Adversary, plus original short fiction, a new deity (Naelib, Lord of Murder), and faction (The Ebon Hand), several supporting cast characters (ever wonder what a Grandfather of Assassins was like?) and monsters (the all new Spectral Host), plus our personally designed Hero Lab files for use in customizing our characters and content in your campaigns!
Give your players a reason to hate again. You can blame it on us...

140320.name: Urizen the Bleak Lord
140320.description:
publisher blurb

URIZEN, THE BLEAK LORD - A DEATH KNIGHT (CLASS BY SUPER GENIUS GAMES); CR 6, 14 and 19!
A horrifying new Infamous Adversary for the Pathfinder RPG!
Towering in an ancient suit of cold blue-black plate, Urizen stands immobile and impassive. Sharp, icy wind cuts around him like a tornado of razor blades, and yet he only stares ahead with blazing blue energy where he once had eyes. Those same eyes once belonged to the living, and now only gaze to the future, to a time when the world is swallowed by ice and he rules upon a throne of bones.
Infamous Adversaries contains: one chilling ready-to-use villain, complete with equipment, a rich background including motives, history, personality, network, resources, lair, tactics, morale, advancement options, a quote, plot hooks to easily insert them into your campaign, local lore, full color art and a vibrant description. The Infamous Adversaries characters are campaign-worthy villains designed to challenge an entire party; not just in combat, but also through less direct methods requiring careful planning and confrontation.
Contained within is many pages of original TPK content including a full depiction of our Infamous Adversary, plus original short fiction, several supporting cast characters and monsters, plus our personally designed Hero Lab files for use in customizing our characters and content in your campaigns! This even includes Hero Lab files for the Death Knight class and a foreward by the creator of the Death Knight class, Owen K. C. Stephens, of Super Genius Games!
Give your players a reason to hate again. You can blame it on us...

140321.name: The Tomb of Caragthax the Reaver
140321.description:
publisher blurb

The Tomb of Caragthax the Reaver

In this old school dungeon crawl -- "The Tomb of Caragthax the Reaver" - the players (of 3rd to 7th level) stumble upon the forgotten cairn of a long dead butcher of ages past. Caragthax's malignance in life has not kept him well in death, and both he and his former companions hungrily await retribution against those who try discovering the secrets sealed away in his tomb and for those who foolishly disturb his millennia of rest.
True to form, TPK Games delivers a unique and fun challenge that your players will not soon forget. As one of the favorite convention games we have run, our fans demanded this to be released.
You asked for it -- your players can blame us.

140322.name: Skeletons
140322.description:
publisher blurb

Give Skeletons New Life!
Skeletons have always been a danger to young heroes venturing into lonely graveyards and ominous tombs, but these classic monsters are quickly replaced by their more powerful undead. Monster Focus: Skeletons is here to give Game Masters a wealth of options to give these clattering undead new "life".
Inside, you'll find a number of options for player characters facing off against skeletons. Options like the Bone Breaker feat, which allows a character to bypass damage reduction, or the new spell Maul of the Righteous, which can crush most skeletons with a single swing. In addition, there are a wide variety of new rules for Game Master to use in their game. There are 7 new magic items like the bone sword, a dreadful weapon that can turn any creature it kills into a skeleton under the wielders control. Game Masters will also find 3 new types of skeleton inside, including the skeletal lord that command the dead and create new minions to serve him.
Monster Focus is a series of short, easy to integrate PDFs, designed to make one classic monster the central theme for an adventure or even a small campaign. Each PDF in the series includes options for player characters and game masters, including new feats, spells, magic items, and more! Written by veteran game designer, Jason Bulmahn, you can be sure that these rules will fit seamlessly into your campaign.

140323.name: Alleyways
140323.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring your towns and cities alive with cool, interesting minor features of note?

Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common urban fixture such as shops, stalls, thieves and so on and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the alleyways in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Alleyways is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Alleyways presents:


One table (100 entries) favoursome alleyway names.
One table (100 entries) atmospheric alleyway descriptions.
One table (20 entries) presenting adventure hooks and complications ripe for use with alleyways.
One table (20 entries and associated NPC bios) presenting the kind of people you might meet in an alleyway.
One table (20 entries) presenting 20 alleyway encounters.

140324.name: Devilmount
140324.description:
From the publisher:

What is DEVILMOUNT? DEVILMOUNT is a fully-playable parody of the OSR's infamous "lost dungeon." The draft manuscript has been heavily re-flavored, revised, and edited into a new experience. Instead of being reverential toward the idea of a Gygaxian megadungeon, DEVILMOUNT reads like a dungeon created by a sixteen year-old who is into Satan, ufo conspiracy theories, and drinking cough syrup.

User note:

The "'lost dungeon'" in the description is Dwimmermount. Devilmount is a parody of a dungeon that, as of Devilmount's March 2013 publication, has only been published in draft form. It was deliberately published with only the artists credited.

140325.name: Market Stalls
140325.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring your towns and cities alive with cool, interesting minor features of note?

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the market stalls in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Market Stalls is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Market Stalls presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting market stalls’ unique appearances and characteristics.
One table (100 entries) presenting the general type of items sold on a market stall.
One table (20 entries) presenting adventure hooks and complications ripe for use with market stalls.
One table (20 entries) presenting 20 NPCs ready to serve as the market stall’s owner.

140326.name: Traders & Craftsmen
140326.description:

One table (100 entries) presenting unique appearances and characteristics for craftsmen’s shops
One table (100 entries) presenting the general type of items found in a shop.
One table (20 entries) presenting adventure hooks and complications ripe for use with a craftsman’s shop
Tables for quickly and easily designing NPCs encountered in a shop

140327.name: Archways
140327.description:
publisher blurb

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible GM's Resource by Brian Gregory

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the archways in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Archways is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Archways presents:
•One table providing detailed descriptions of an archway’s appearance and characteristics.
•One table presenting additional archway features such as fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
•Two clever archway-based traps (CRs 5-9) along with several additional variant traps.
This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

140328.name: Bridges
140328.description:
Publisher Blurb:

One table providing detailed descriptions of a bridge’s appearance and characteristics.
One table presenting additional bridge features such as graffiti, discarded equipment and more!
Five clever bridge-based traps (CR 2-7) along with several additional variant traps.

A new variant monster—the alluring mimic.

One table providing detailed descriptions of a door’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional door features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
Three clever door-based traps (CRs 8-10).

140332.name: Dungeon Names
140332.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM'S RESOURCE by Creighton Broadhurst

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the name of your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Dungeon Names is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Dungeon Names presents:

Information on how to name your dungeon.
One table presenting 100 different kinds of dungeons.
One table presenting 20 pre-generated dungeon names.
One table presenting hundreds of suitable dungeon descriptors.
One table presenting over 100 dungeon subjects.
One table of 20 pre-generated tribal names.
Two tables presenting 150 names of fell folk associated with dungeons.
One table presenting 100 different parts of a dungeon.
One table presenting 20 pre-generated dungeon level names.

140334.name: Fountains
140334.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible GM'S RESOURCE by Ben Armitage

Three clever fountain-based traps (CRs 4-7).

140335.name: Pools
140335.description:

Dungeon Dressing: Pools presents:

One table providing detailed descriptions of a pool’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional pool’s features such as contents, hidden treasures, magical properties and more!
Two clever pool-based traps (CRs 6-8).
Two proper Old School magic pools complete with weird and wonderful effects.

140336.name: Sarcophagi
140336.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM's Resource by David Posener

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each installment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the sarcophagi in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi presents:

General information on the kind of sarcophagi adventurers can expect to find in dungeons.
One table providing detailed descriptions of a sarcophagi ’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional sarcophagi features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
Three clever sarcophagi-based traps (CRs 3-10).
Four haunts to (well) haunt your sarcophagi.

140337.name: Secret Doors
140337.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM's Resource by Greg Marks

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the secret doors in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Secret Doors is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Secret Doors presents:

One table providing detailed descriptions of a secret door’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional secret door features such as contents, hidden treasures, magical properties and more!
Four clever secret door-based traps (CRs 6-8).

140338.name: Thrones
140338.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the thrones in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Thrones is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Thrones presents:


One table providing detailed descriptions of a throne’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional throne features such as contents, hidden treasures, magical properties and more!
Seven clever throne-based traps (CRs 1/2-17).

140339.name: Portcullises
140339.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the portcullises in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Portcullises is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Portcullises presents:


One table providing detailed descriptions of a portcullises’ characteristics.
One table presenting additional portcullis features such as contents, hidden treasures, magical properties and more!
Several clever portcullis-based traps (CRs 6-8).

140341.name: Solar
140341.description: Solar will attempt to usher in a new style of card games with its almost unheard of game mechanics. The game will start with both players choosing who picks the first character, that person starts on defense, the other play, on offense. Then, they both take turns choosing characters until they both have 12 card decks to play with. Each character shall feature its own art work and class, as well as one, two, or three attacks to use while on offense,and one or two defense moves while on defense. At the beginning of each turn, both players draw 3 characters from the top of the deck, and put one on the battlefield, and the other two on the bottom of his/her deck. Then, the player on offense may use his characters attack skills on his/her opponent's characters. If the hit lands successfully, the character is defeated. The game is over,and the winner decided, when one player has lost all of his characters and is labeled the loser.

140343.description:
The ancient manuscripts talk about a Leviathan, a huge creature lying on the silt bed of the lagoon on whose back the city has its foundations. All manuscripts agree on its eternal sleep and they all tell that the beast will wake up one day, shaking the city from its muddy roots, smashing the vitrified stilts on which the city stands, and crashing it into the seething sea where the monster will rise. The ancients say, however, that there will be signs; it is written that the Venetians will feel the tremors, that they would therefore save themselves from the monster, who will recover his freedom by plunging into the waves a deserted city.

But there were no signs. What ancients did not know is that the Leviathan is not alive. For centuries, the city lived and prospered on the back of a corpse. That corpse, though, is now awakening – and with it the dead arise from the lagoon...

In the cooperative game Carnival Zombie, players lead a group of characters who are fleeing on terra firma from the terror that has emerged from the lagoon of Venice. This group of characters must make its way through hordes of rotting "Infected" to leave the city, and players need to rush as the Leviathan upon which the foundations of Venice were built is awakening. Thus, it's only a matter of time before the city sinks in the dark waters of the lagoon.

Each game is divided into several nights and days. During the nights, players hide in trenches behind the barricades to resist the attacks of the Infected. During the day, players move through the city, which is shaken by tremors. The Infected are drawn by the groans of the Leviathan in the abyss to help their master free itself from the rotting stilts that nail it to the silt bed.

Players have several ways to get out of town, but little time to do it – and their path is hindered by the bosses, the most implacable servants of the Leviathan. If the players do make it out, they can assess their skills – and set a goal for next time – by counting the points scored during the game.
140343.name: Carnival Zombie
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe
The Game Pit Episode 14.3 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2013
The Game Pit: Episode 15.1 - Council Chamber Essen Review

140344.name: Mijn eerste verkeersspel
140344.description: “Mijn eerste verkeersspel” (=My first road game) is a dice game for kids. The players have to walk from home to a particular purpose (e.g. school) on the other side of the road. The rules for pedestrian traffic have to be followed. Cars on the road can be moved by die roll. The game ends when all players have arrived at the goal. The main issue is finishing, although the player who finishes first wins. The game can be played with different rule variations.

140345.name: Pescadores Intrépidos
140345.description:
A game about fishery. You go out by dice rolls with your diver and take chances fishing sea creatures for points - harder game is tricker to get and rare, easy game worth less points. Once everyone has gone around once and is back, the one with the most points wins.

-----

Um jogo sobre pescaria, onde cada jogador movimenta seus peões pelo tabuleiro, conforme os pontos obtidos nos dados. O objetivo é chegar à zonas de pesca, onde tentarão conquistar troféus e pontos em cada pescaria. Criaturas marinhas pescadas em profundidades maiores valem mais pontos. Vence o jogador que possuir mais pontos no final da partida.

140346.name: The Valley of Eternal Rest
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
140346.description:
From the front cover:

Dare you to enter The Valley of Eternal Rest, where the tombs of the ancients are guarded by unspeakable monsters and an unbreakable curse?

This is the & Publishing Group's first adventure module, a joint venture between readers and the staff of & Magazine.

140347.name: Rage from the Waves
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
140347.description:
From the front cover:

What horror from the depths is leaving ships adrift, cargo untouched, stealing the crews for some unspeakable fate?

140348.name: Beneath the Windowless Tower
140348.description:
From the first page:

Malazar the Mage, like all great wizards, was a noted eccentric. His particular obsession was the collection of certain rare and bizarre antiquities, unearthed at great time and personal expense from long-forgotten buried cities where saner men feared to tread.
It was on his final such expedition that Malazar reputedly uncovered a jewel of great value and magical power, the so-called Egg of Desire. In an area of remote hills, he constructed a high tower in which to house his prize – a tower with neither windows nor doors.
As the years drew on, Malazar began to disdain city life. He withdrew more and more to his strange, windowless tower, conducting his business by emissary.
