It is now more than a decade since there has been any word from either Malazar or his agents, and persistent rumour among the more knowledgeable circles of thieves and treasure- hunters has it that the mage is dead, and within the tower his jewel lies free for the taking - if only there were some way to get inside...

140349.name: Caravan
140349.description:
From the introduction:

Book of Quests is a collection of seven, loosely- linked adventures for RuneQuest 6th Edition. This scenario, taken from Book of Quests, is
intended to act as a preview of the book and form a free scenario in its own right, introducing Games Masters and Players to the adventures.

140350.name: The Garden of al-Astorion (OGL 3.5)
140350.description:
From the introduction:

Gentle Reader!
The Garden of al-Astorion is the translation of an adventure module I originally designed in a single evening for a Hungarian game convention and later revised and expanded for self publication on a whim. To this date, it remains the only adventure to be released in the country under the d20 license – although it was successful as an amateur effort, others were reluctant to follow in its steps, and I lacked the time to do a follow-up.
Although more than three years have passed since initial inception and almost three since first publication, I nevertheless decided to do a translation for the benefit of interested gamers who didn’t have a chance to read the original. Although I would do some things differently if I designed the module today (hopefully better, too), I decided to preserve the original as well as a translation could allow instead. I believe it can and it should stand on its own merits. Let it be judged with this consideration – but let it be Judged with a critical eye towards its failings!

140351.name: The Garden of al-Astorion (Castles & Crusades)
140351.description:
From the introduction:

Gentle Reader!
The Garden of al-Astorion is the translation of an adventure module I originally designed in a single evening for a Hungarian game convention and later revised and expanded for self publication on a whim. To this date, it remains the only adventure to be released in the country under the d20 license – although it was successful as an amateur effort, others were reluctant to follow in its steps, and I lacked the time to do a follow-up.
Although more than three years have passed since initial inception and almost three since first publication, I nevertheless decided to do a translation for the benefit of interested gamers who didn’t have a chance to read the original. Although I would do some things differently if I designed the module today (hopefully better, too), I decided to preserve the original as well as a translation could allow instead. I believe it can and it should stand on its own merits. Let it be judged with this consideration – but let it be Judged with a critical eye towards its failings!

140352.name: Garden of the Hag Queen
140352.description:
From the publishers website:

The Hag Queen has ruled for centuries and her baleful garden blights the landscape. Can you survive it's inhabitants?

140353.name: Voxel Invaders
140353.description:
Voxel Invaders is a modern clone of Space Invaders powered by true voxel graphics.

Control is ultra simple, just move the spaceship with one finger. Collect bonus to obtain new weapons and lives, make your way through asteroid fields and be surprised by dramatic 3D immersions or radical change of gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

140354.name: No Fences to Mend
140354.description:
From publisher blurb:

About two days out of Lowhollow, on the way to Redmarsh and Lake Bloodmoon, lie Mount Dath and Elp's Climb. Between these two snowcapped mountains, the Gnarlay Wood is settled. The dominators of Peakvale give these forests and their surroundings some room, not only because of the ork-kindred bandits that prowl the roads or thereabouts, but because of the Iueresa elf clan that dwells within the forests proper. Somewhere in the midst of these forbidding wilder lands lies the [Temple of the Hag].

This is an adventure for common kindred delvers of levels 3 to 4 using 7.5 edition rules, although it is easy to modify for 5th edition.

140355.name: Hot Nights in Lowhollow
140355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finally back to town after a hard day's tunnel hacking (or swamp-slogging)? Well, there might be a bit more going on than you expect. Lowhollow isn’t the sprawling, kingdom-sized area of urban settlement that Pholus and Estvol are, but it has a sizeable population bolstered by land and seafaring trade routes.

Have as much adventure in the city as out in the wilds. Delvers in Lowhollow explore not only the dingy side of the city, but the consequences of getting caught. If you get too careless while you're dreaming of the riches of the harbor district, you could very well end up working the Pitt.

This is an adventure setting for common kindred delvers of levels 3 to 5 using 7.5 edition rules, although it is easy to modify for 5th and other editions.

140356.name: Temple of the Hag
140356.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finding the Temple of the Hag is not as simple as getting from point A to point B. The dark spirits that live within keep their temples well hidden. Sword-bladed grass, quicksand, and the dreaded doomsday skeeters are only a few of the dangers that skulk along the haunted paths of the Swamp of Doom. Somewhere within, living in the shadow of the Bat-Winged Fiend himself, the mysterious swamp hag bottles her stolen souls.

This scenario is set in Scott Malthouse’s Peakvale campaign setting. While it can be incorporated into any other T&T world, such as Trollworld or Elder, we recommend that you check out Trollish Delver Games for details first. The player characters should either have Combat Adds of 50 or more or be able to cast at least a couple of 3rd level spells. It is assumed that the players have survived the [No Fences to Mend] scenario (and possibly had a few [Hot Nights in Lowhollow]), but the scenario can just as easily be played as a standalone adventure.

It should be noted that while this scenario is designed for T&T 7 and 7.5, it can easily be adjusted to any edition.

140357.name: Wett-Turnen
140357.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; endimg on a red space follow instructions glued on lid inside;
remarks:
probably published befor WWII

140358.name: Jekyll & Hyde
140358.description:
A two-player, print and play game designed for 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest.

Players take turns moving a pawn around London using tokens as action points. The Jekyll player is trying to discover the parts of a cure, to rid themselves of the Hyde personality. Hyde is trying to take full control of the pawn, by limiting the Jekyll players ability to use the tokens.

Most of the players' actions turn into a tug of war with the other player. Moving the pawn can place it in an advantageous location for the other player, and playing cards gives the other player a chance to draw them into their hand. Players must try to accomplish their goals without aiding their opponent.

140359.name: Collective Endeavour Journal  (Issue 1 - 2008)
140359.description:
Table of Contents:

EDITORIAL

SALISBURY PLAIN (Hot War)
To the west of the capital, beyond the ruins of Porton Down, lies the blasted wilderness of Salisbury Plain, once the site of the Army’s most ambitious training exercises, and now home to the monstrous survivors of the War.

SHADOW MASTERY (Solipsist)
An in-depth look at how to create, prepare and use the Shadow in play, with optional rules to allow players to better investigate, destroy and embrace its manifestations.

DIRK HEMLOCK AND THE BLACKFEL INCIDENT (Pulp!)

A quickstart scenario for Pulp! – a miniatures game of two-fisted action!

QUARRY HILL BUNKER/GARTWOOD ROYAL HOSPITAL (Dead of Night)

Two terrifying locations for games of Dead of Night! Clamber down into the dank, dangerous depths of Quarry Hill Bunker, or pry up a board, clamber in and walk the wards of the abandoned Gartwood Royal Hospital. But always remember to bring a torch...

TOY SOLDIERS (Contenders)
Boxers aren’t the only people who struggle with adversity and fight for money. This light-hearted article explains how to use Contenders to tell stories about Wargamers and the unique challenges they face.

FIRMS & HATCHETMEN (Hot War)
A look at using some real-life criminals in games of Hot War. In the aftermath of an apocalyptic war, those who prey on the weak and vulnerable will survive and thrive.

DISPOSABLE HEROES (3:16 Carnage Amongst The Stars)
This supplement for 3:16 Carnage Amongst The Stars has exclusive material, including additional planet descriptors and a list of sub-missions for the disposable heroes of the 3:16th Expeditionary Force.

PRETENDERS (Contenders)
A companion to the more light hearted Toy Soldiers, Pretenders is a wargame modification to the Contenders engine. Pretenders provides a campaign narrative and roleplaying slant for any wargaming system.

I DEMAND SATISFACTION (Duty and Honour)
Two men meeting on a misty moor, pistols drawn and ready - there is only one way to settle a matter of honour between gentlemen, a duel! ‘I Demand Satisfaction’ brings tense and deadly duelling to Duty & Honour, including rules, new traits and a despicable NPC.

BROTHERS IN ARMS (Mob Justice)
Life as one of the O’Leary brothers has never been easy. Your father runs the Irish gangs and your siblings are in deep with the ‘less polite’ elements of Chicago society. Now your Father lies dead, shot by one the factions after his turf, and it is up to you and your brothers to sort it out.

140361.description:
The third expansion to Cards Against Humanity features 100 new cards – 25 black question/statement cards and 75 white answer cards – to be used with the base game, in addition to 12 blank cards.

In this card game, players take turns being the Card Czar, which means they read a black question card or a fill-in-the-blank statement card. The other players then select a white answer card from the ten in hand that they think best or most humorously fits the question/statement. The Card Czar then shuffles the answers and chooses the one he likes best, with that answer's owner receiving the black card as his "awesome point" for winning the round.

Once a player has at least one awesome point, he can wager an awesome point when giving a white answer card in order to throw in a second answer card, theoretically giving him a better chance to be chosen. The winner of the round receives the original black card as well as any that are wagered in that round.

Play continues until a pre-determined score is reached, or until everyone is tired from laughing so hard.
140361.name: Cards Against Humanity: Third Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty-Seven: Mad Against Humanity

140363.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 1 - Winter/Spring 2010)
140363.description:
From publisher blurb:

This illustrated collection features two full-length GM adventures by Stephen Butka and Tom K. Loney, along with an introduction by Tunnels & Trolls creator Ken St. Andre.

The Sorcerer's Chimney: a satirical romp through realms that may be uncomfortably familiar.
The Wuthering Depths: Monsters, dark elves, deep caves, and just a touch of gothic romance. Who could ask for more?

140364.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 2 - Summer-Fall 2010)
140364.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within these pages lurk horrifying adventures by a group of ghoulish writers.

"The Ephemera Furnace" by the sinister Christina Lea will chill you with a tale of mysterious bargains, disembodied limbs and groaning abominations.
The murderous Mike Larsen will thrust you through hellish portals into the horrifying abyss of his dark mind in "Resurrection Missions."
"The Farmer’s Daughter," a solo adventure by the twisted David Crowell will give you nightmares of scarecrows, cattle mutilations, and things that go bump in the night.
Finally, in "Trouble among the Tumbled Stones," the foul Tom K. Loney will take you on a terrible journey to a place where travellers have been vanishing mysteriously. Could this be the work of bandits, or is something more disturbing afoot on the road to Grimehaven?

140365.description: Time to throw a multiplayer mage brawl! The Mage Wars Action Marker Set allows you to have up to four players in a game of Mage Wars by giving players three and four their own action markers in yellow and green (or purple and gray, depending on the marker set you choose). This accessory also includes two quickcast markers so that your mages are always prepared for battle.
140365.name: Mage Wars: Action Marker Set

140366.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 3 - Winter/Spring 2011)
140366.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the bridge, the ship’s crew gets ready to use the teleport gate. The mage is chant­ing on the navigation platform, casting a spell as the ship approaches the gate. The ship begins to drift through as the mage finishes the spell. Poof! The crew find themselves in another solar system. And out the window they see a dragon flying toward them...

This special issue of Elder Tunnels contains two GM adventures, one solo, and one, uh, booty table, designed to give readers the opportunity to explore the science fantasy genre in the T&T setting. From gene harvesting to time travel, from invoked AIs to sorcerous inventions, this issue of Elder Tunnels brings to you a rollicking good mix of tech and Troll.

140367.name: & (Issue 1 - Summer 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Creature Ecology: Ecology of the Carrion Crab
Featured Fiction: Gathering at the Smoky Tavern
Starting at Level One ~ Why Bother?
That Savage Kobold: Is Low-Level AD&D Heroic or Not?
The Toy Box: Pre-Assembled Equipment Packs
140367.description:
user summary

Filling the gaps for old school gamers!

This issue has a focus on low level adventuring.

140368.name: & (Issue 2 - Fall 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Creature feature 1: Ecology of the Bone Guardian
Creature Feature 3: Vampires from the Dresden Files
Review: The AD&D Core Books Reprint
The House of Ponce, Bank and Moneylender
140368.description:
user summary

Filling in the gaps for old school gamers.

This issue has a focus on the undead.

140369.name: & (Issue 3 - Winter 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Creature Feature 1: Ecology of the Siren
Friend or Foe: Sardak, the Mad Cleric of Nerull
One Page Dungeon: The Sea Hag's Lair
The Wreck of the Stalwart Lady
Yo, Ho, Ho, and Ever Full Bottle of Rum
140369.description:
user summary

Filling in the gaps in old school gaming.

This issue has a focus on nautical adventures.

140370.name: & (Issue 4 - Spring 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Friend or Foe 2: Three Dwarven Weaponsmiths
Guilds, Colleges, and Cabals: Case Study 1
Guilds, Colleges, and Cabals: Case Study 2
Spell Caster's Paradise 1: Beefing Up Cure X Wounds Spells
140370.description:
Filling in the gaps for old school gamers.

This issue has a focus on Classes & Guilds.

140371.description:
From the Publisher's website:

At their most desperate hour, the proud trollkin kriels set out to awaken the legendary mountain kings-ancient monsters of unimaginable size and power. Wurmwood, however, has its own designs on the slumbering beasts and plots to turn them on civilization. Meanwhile, the Skorne Empire seeks retribution against an ancient foe, and Everblight works to perfect his most terrifying dragonspawn yet.

HORDES: Gargantuans brings you the next thrilling chapter of the HORDES saga. Bulk up your game with:

• Powerful new gargantuans-giant warbeasts that tower over armies and bring all-new strategies to the table.
• New warlocks for each faction, including the first-ever warlock units.
• New units and solos to expand HORDES armies.
• New narrative fiction picking up directly after the exciting events of HORDES: Domination.
• A painting and modeling guide to help you prepare your gargantuans for combat.
• Theme Force lists for each new warlock, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces found in the HORDES world.
140371.name: Hordes: Gargantuans

140372.name: Obelisk of Forgotten Memories
140372.description:
From the introduction:

The Obelisk is moderately large outdoor adventure with a small attached dungeon
for a party levels 1-3.
This adventure was occasioned by my players deciding to take a lark into the
wilderness rather than exploring Patrick Wetmore's wonderful megadungeon the
Anomalous Subsurface Environment (ASE). It's my own attempt to create another,
smaller adventure location that seems reasonable within Pat's world. It
contains several elements (guns, ancient technology, God's eye's) that won't
make sense outside of ASE, but I suppose it could be run as a simple graveyard
based cult-smashing expedition in with a little modification. It's also an
attempt at an adventure in the old style of the TSR products I grew up with, or
at least as I remember them played in the hands of murderously inclined pre-
teen boys on lazy Summer afternoons. The encounters within are not scaled to
allow a 1st level party to win in a stand-up heroic fight. There are encounters, and even individual creatures (especially the special random encounters), quite capable of slaughtering a party within a couple rounds, but this is how it should be, as they can be avoided or negotiated with.

140373.name: Prison of the Hated Pretender
140373.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure for a party of adventurers levels 0-1. The Prison contains several traps and monsters that could fairly readily kill a first level character – but the traps are not unobtrusive and the monsters can be fled from easily.

140374.name: Quest of the Mist Golem - Mist Hold
140374.description:
From the introduction:

Murq Thendival (better known as “Murq the devious”) was at one time a wizard known and hated in Veluna City. Suspected of having dealings with Temple of Elemental Evil during its first heyday, the mage built his laboratory-tower in a forested area of the Lortmils, which he warded with killing fogs and mists. He was also known to have humanoids of varying types as troops who would deal with any interlopers who managed to make their way past the wizard’s vaporous barriers.

Over time, Murq realized that his possible alliance with the temple was on shaky ground, since divinations revealed that the governments of Furyondy, Veluna and Verbobonc were preparing to move in force against it. Rather then fall with his erstwhile “allies” when his dealings were discovered, Murq set out to gain personal power in another way.

User summary:

An adventure for characters level 5-7

140375.name: The Red Demon in the Vile Fens
140375.description:
From the introduction:

A Labyrinth Lord Adventure set in the Land of the Thousand Towers (by Patrick Wetmore in his Anomalous Subsurface Environment products). This small location has a strong Science Fantasy feel and was designed to present a dangerous challenge to characters of 3rd to 4th level.

140376.name: Tempus Gelidum
140376.description:
From the website:

(3-5 Level Adventure) A small indoor lair of a powerful monster and its minions,
designed for insertion into mid-level (3-5) Anomalous Subsurface Environment wilderness adventure.

140377.name: Walk Through The Forge
140377.description:
user summary

Walk Through The Forge is a story game by Dev Purkayastha for Game Chef 2012.

In it, players collaborate to tell the stories of participants in a war, pursuing their goals, confronting issues. During gameplay, a map is created and altered, keeping track of the conflicts.

140378.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 4 - Summer 2011)
140378.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, here I am at the lake, enjoying idyllic mornings swimming, afternoons traipsing about the wilderness, evenings grilling up dinner for the family, and I'm thinking, wow, that's pretty much what's happening in this issue of Elder Tunnels.

Y'know, all you'd need to do is put a few giant otters and tentacle-headed aquatic humanoids in the water, animate those burgers, scatter a handful of sentient reptiles and crazed human-sacrificing ancestor worshippers in the woods, and it would be exactly the same. Exactly! Really, I don't know why we bothered with this issue. Just go on vacation.

This larger-than-ever issue of Elder Tunnels contains two GM adventures and one solo.

140379.name: The Terminal Hours
140379.description:
Author's description

The Terminal Hours is a narrative RPG where the GM takes the role of Coyote, a (mostly) benevolent trickster spirit, and the players take the role of a person during the last hours of their life. These people have to fight their way past the challenges of the spirit world and the real world in order to accomplish their dying wishes, but they have to work together to have any chance of survival. This is a mostly traditional RPG, where the players act and the GM narrates.

The principals of the game are collaborative storytelling, emergent character stories, and that you play to find out what happens - whether the characters “succeed” or “fail” should be totally subordinate to the story at hand.

140380.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 5 - Fall 2011)
140380.description:
From publisher blurb:

This abominably capacious Halloween issue of Elder Tunnels is hideously bulging with unholy treasures, including more spooky art than you can shake a scythe at, and the following:

Bats in the Belfry, a solo adventure by David R. Crowell
Cabin in the Woods IV: The Stabbening, a GM adventure by Scott Malthouse
Wallas's Tree, flash fiction and a monster by Katje Romanov
The Persistent Drifter, a BEAN! solo by Jeff Freels
Dead on the Run, a GM adventure by Mike Larsen
The Wendigo, a monster by Tom K. Loney
Unhallowed Ground, a short story by Neil Riebe
Woodsman, Don't Spare that Tree, a GM adventure by Ken St. Andre

140381.name: Speed
140381.description:
The object of Speed is for the player to move his/her ship, plane, car and train along the designated routes from start to finish. The first player completing the routes for all four vehicles wins. Two to four players may play. There are 16 player pieces. One each of ship, plane, car and train in four colors (red, green, black and blue)

Movement is driven by card play. Each player selects four cards from the 40 card deck to start the game. Each player must maintain four cards in hand at all times. There are four "suites" (in red and black) corresponding to each of the four types of vehicles. The first player plays a card in the suite of his/her choice, announces the card and plays it face up. The player then draws from the deck to replenish the hand. The other players follow, and the player who played the highest value card in the suite lead gets to move the associated piece that number of spaces forward along the corresponding route. If a player does not have a card of the suite lead, they must play another card from another suite. The used cards are placed in a discard pile and shuffled if the draw pile is depleted.

140382.name: The Jolly Animal Picnic Game
140382.description: The first player to reach the finish (Picnic Grounds) by any count wins the game. Two to four persons may play. Players take turns spinning and moving. If a player lands on a red colored space, the player must take a card and follow the printed instructions. There are 25 reward/penalty cards in a complete game. If the cards are exhausted during play they are reshuffled.

140383.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 9 - Mar 2011)
rpgissuearticle: 2. Großer Aktionstag zur Fantasy in Koblenz
Abenteuer-Module, die keiner kennt: In Search of the Unknown
Cthulhu - Berge des Wahnsinns: Kampagnenband I: Aufbruch in die Antarktis
Das Werk des C.S.Lewis - Geliebt und verschrien
Der Griff nach den Sternen - Das Weltbild, das Steampunk und Pulp hervorbrachte
Die Kunst zu töten - Mordmethoden und Kriminalistik durch die Jahrtausende: Mord und Totschlag
Die Magie der Bilder - Ein Interview mit Bernd Perplies
Expedition ins Unbekannte - Auf den Spuren des Dr. Ephraim Langbloms
Labyrinth Lord Werkstattbericht: Drachen über Larm
Master's Survival Pack VII: Grundrisse für Gaslight
Midnight Syndicate - Neue Klänge aus der Gruft
Musikalische Luftschiffpiraten - Die Steampunk-Band Abney Park im Porträt
Saisonauftakt in Biebelsheim - Sonne, Sang und Lautenklang
Steam Noir: Die Macher von Steam Noir über ihr Projekt
[Die spitze Feder] Was piepst denn da?
140383.description: Steampunk: Welten unter Dampf is the topic of issue #9.

140384.name: Doom Paintings
140384.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the doom paintings in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Doom Paintings is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Doom Paintings presents:


General information on doom paintings.
One table providing detailed descriptions of a doom painting’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional doom painting’s features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
Several clever doom painting-based traps (CRs 2-10).

140386.name: Assassin's Creed: Arena
140386.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Assassin's Creed: Arena – based on the Assassin's Creed video game series from Ubisoft – players compete to uncover the best targets for assassination, but before you can go in for the kill, sometimes you have to deal with pesky guards as well as your opponents. Players will collect cards and treasure, move guards, and hide within the city of Constantinople until they find their time to strike. Combat is handled through cardplay, and the player who best manages his cards will have the best chance at victory.

At the start of each player's turn, he draws an Event card, which can spawn new targets in the outer city, move guards, or allow you to find a tunnel to another section of the city. Moving guards is a great way to get them away from you and place them near your opponents. Targets cannot be assassinated while a guard is nearby, but fortunately the guards can be dispatched if need be.

Cards in hand drive the action, but they are also your hit points. If you run out of cards in hand, you die — but just like in a video game, you will soon respawn at your starting area. Moving and attacking targets (or your fellow players) requires playing cards, so doing too much all at once can be risky. Couple that with trying to avoid the guards and you are in for a tension-filled game of cat-and-mouse. To replenish your hand, complete objectives on your movement cards or hide. Hiding in the outer city is easy and grants you lots of extra cards. When you enter the merchant district or the area around the palace, there just aren’t as many places to hide and you will not draw many cards.

Combat is handled through cardplay. No dice are required, although a six-sided die is included to resolve some guard movement. Do you save your best cards for movement or to go in for the kill? He who risks the most has the chance for the most reward!

140388.name: Fighters Club
140388.description:
User Summary

Fighters Club is an online fighting game in which you control a character in an arena that may contain as few as one other opponent but as many as 5. The character can be customized to great extent, most of which amount to appearance changes, though combat attributes can be adjusted as well.

While fighting, the player can target particular locations on their opponent's bodies, causing deliberate types of harm. Blocking must be targeted as well, allowing a player to defend decisively.

140389.name: Global Operations
140389.description:
Global Operations is a first-person tactical shooter computer game developed by Barking Dog Studios and published by both Crave Entertainment and Electronic Arts. It was released in March 2002, following its public multiplayer beta version which contained only the Quebec map. The full game featured thirteen maps and featured both a single player and a multiplayer mode, which supported up to twenty-four players and three teams. Afterwards, a multiplayer demo with only the Antarctica map was released.
The game itself was focused on firearms in a special forces setting, with a mixture of military and counterterrorist type themes. The game featured a large number of firearms, numbering in the dozens and including a wide selection of handguns and rifles. Many of them could be further customized as well. For example, a C-mag and silencer could be added. The multi-player offered different classes (Reconnaissance, Commando, Medic, Heavy Weapons, Sniper, Demolitions and Intelligence Officer) with extra abilities and class-specific weapons. All classes could use all other classes' firearms (by picking them up off the battlefield), but each class might not have the same level of skill with a given weapon (such as less precision).
Other features existed as well, including a life-sign tracking device, as well other game items like tear gas grenades, smoke grenades and medkit. A LAW (Lightweight Anti-tank Weapon) could be used, as well as night vision and thermal vision.

Source: Wikipedia, "Global Operations", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

140390.name: Rainbow Park
140390.description:
The rain has stopped and the sun is out with a shining smile, but the beautiful rainbow is nowhere to be seen! It's all because those playful colors of the rainbow got distracted by the fun facilities in the park. They are running around and having a good time all over the park. Let's go find those colors and make the rainbow appear!

Contents: 54 game cards, including 49 Element cards and 5 pass cards.

This is a memory game where all of the cards are double-sided. Players take turns turning over cards to score matches. Players can collect pass cards and re-arrange the position of the game cards surrounding that card.

The game ends when the number of Element cards left on the playing surface is less than or equal to the number of the colors used to play the game. For example, if 5 colors were used to play the game, the game ends when there are 5 or fewer Element cards left on the playing surface.

At the end of the game, each player should add up the values of the cards he/she has collected: 1 point for each Element card, and 2 points for each Pass card. The highest scoring player wins the game.

140391.name: Pyramid Solitaire
140391.description:
Play Pyramid Solitaire for free and see if you can scale the pyramid in this classic card game! Combine any two cards that add up to 13 to clear them. Kings are worth 13 and can be cleared with one click.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140392.name: Microsoft Minesweeper
140392.description:
Windows Store Description
Play the classic puzzle game that has been a part of Windows for more than 20 years, now re-imagined for Windows 8. Featuring adjustable difficulty, classic Minesweeper gameplay, and a brand new Adventure mode, Microsoft Minesweeper is better than ever.

Classic Mode
Play the logic game you know and love, now with updated graphics and sound. Play with a touch screen or with a mouse and keyboard to mark the locations of all the mines without uncovering any of them! Start with an Easy puzzle and work your way up to Expert.

NEW GAME MODE - Adventure Mode
Players who want a different kind of challenge can try this brand new game mode! Use your skills in Adventure mode to guide your brave hero to the center of Earth, collecting riches along the way. Blending traditional Minesweeper rules with fun new goals, Adventure Mode is a fresh take on a classic!

NEW FEATURE - Daily Challenges
Players receive new Challenges every day. Complete them to earn prizes and compete with your friends!

Xbox Integration
Log in with your Xbox account to earn achievements, compete with your friends, and more. You can even play, pause, and resume your game on any Windows 8 device - start a game on one device, pause it, and pick up on another device where you left off!
Read less
Features
•Classic Minesweeper rules.
•Brand new Adventure Mode - new twist on a classic game!
•Daily Challenges – Complete new Challenges each day to win prizes and compete with friends!
•Adjustable difficulty setting.
•Xbox enabled - gives you access to achievements, leaderboards and your friends!
•Play, pause, and resume your game on any Windows 8 device.
•Supports touch screen or mouse/keyboard controls.

Source: The Publisher Website.

140393.name: Taptiles
140393.description:
Find pairs of tiles to complete puzzles in this exciting matching game with a unique twist! When you can’t find a match, just rotate the 3D puzzle to view the other side! Taptile includes three modes of play and countless puzzles for a game experience unlike any other!

Source: The Developer Website.

140394.name: Trizzle
140394.description:
Think you can stack up to the competition? Trizzle combines fast-paced match three puzzle play with tricky combo-stacking of adorable Russian stacking dolls! Slide dolls and match three similar dolls to combine them into one larger doll. Keep matching to grow the dolls and get a massive score boost! But careful, you only have so many moves. If you run out of moves, it's game over! Think you have what it takes to beat more levels than anyone else?

Source: The Developer Website.

140395.name: Pog Word Builder Game
140395.description:
Pogs are small cardboard disks with a variety of designs on them; they were popular in the early 90's. In the original game of Pogs, players would gamble Pogs from their own collection in an attempt to expand their collection further. Players would stack Pogs face down in a stack and throw a 'Kini' (a hard plastic disk, sometimes referred to as a 'Slammer') from above in an attempt to turn the Pogs over and claim them for their collection.

Pog word builder combines the classic action of Pog with the challenging gameplay of Scrabble. Use 1 letter and 2 letter Pogs to build the biggest words possible. Pog's are obtained in the same way as the original game, by by trying to turn over a stack of Pogs containing unknown letters. The player who builds the most words wins.

As the emphasis of Pog word builder is on the number of words, rather than the length or the quality of words, the game is easily accessible to young players.

140397.name: Zane
140397.description:
What is Zane ?

Zane is harmony.

Absolute new logic game with unique game play and visual logic.
Everyone of the 50 levels has a unique beautiful solution.
Find the balance of your inner Zane and reach harmony.

Source: The Developer Website.

140398.name: Tribal Dance
140398.description:
A BIG AFRICAN STORY
Bongo, a young Maasai guy, always wanted to be a shaman. One day he helps old shaman Pongo and as a reward the shaman shows him how to make Drum Magic. Drum Magic is an old shaman technique, jumping on big drums in the right order calls weather spells like Rain, Thunder or Earthquake. The old shaman gives Bongo a book. Bongo and his brother, hunter Ungo help their Maasai village and then they hit the road to help villages in Africa.

- 5 tribes/villages
- 25 unique levels
- 10 + 4 bonus minigames
- playable tutorial

ACTION, LOGIC, FUN & MORE ACTION
In every level, Bongo needs to find out what spell or combination of spells solve the given problem, then call them by hitting the drums with his jumps is the right order.

Source: The Game Website.

140399.name: Shuffled Art
140399.description:
STORY
Louis Cruchot, the inspector from Saint Tropez, helps 5 top European galleries after they have been visited by some rare kind of vandals. Some of the best paintings are cut to pieces of different shapes, you need to solve them.

- 25 paintings
- 5 galleries
- 5 shapes
- 5 unique ways to solve
- Story & Free Play modes
- use your own gallery photo or photo taken by the camera
- hints
- hours and hours of gameplay

Source: The Developer Website.

140400.name: Monopole
140400.description:
Very fun game with unique control method using built-in compass.
First game ever where you must head north when playing it.

Catch magnet orbs with your magnetron.
You can use magnetron with one, two or four poles.

Check the global Highscore and be the best player.

!! Works only on devices with compass (iPhone 3Gs, iPhone 4(S))
Source: The Developer Website.

140401.name: Buzzle
140401.description:
Buzzle is a hexagon-shaped tiles sliding puzzle game.
How fast can you put the tiles in order?
Free play and Challenge modes.
You can choose pictures from gallery included in the game, your photo albums or photo taken by the camera.
OpenFeint powered LeaderBoards and Achievements, compare your times and number of moves with the others from around the world or your friends.

Source: The Developer Website.

140402.name: Dizzle
140402.description:
Dizzle is a diamond-shaped tiles sliding puzzle game.
How fast can you put the tiles in order?
Free play and Challenge modes.
You can choose pictures from gallery included in the game, your photo albums or photo taken by the camera.
OpenFeint powered LeaderBoards and Achievements, compare your times and number of moves with the others from around the world or your friends.

Source: The Developer Website.

140403.name: Squazzle
140403.description:
Squazzle is a square-shaped tiles sliding puzzle game.
How fast can you put the tiles in order?
Free play and Challenge modes.
You can choose pictures from gallery included in the game, your photo albums or photo taken by the camera.
OpenFeint powered LeaderBoards and Achievements, compare your times and number of moves with the others from around the world or your friends.

Source: The Developer Website.

140404.description:
Catan Shop Description

Here is a complete replacement set of game cards for use with The Settlers of Catan.

Components:
95 Resource Cards
25 Development Cards
140404.name: Settlers of Catan Replacement Cards

140405.description:
Catan Shop Description
Here is a set of replacement expansion game cards for use with Catan: Cities & Knights®, the expansion for Settlers of Catan®.

Components:

36 Commodity Cards
54 Progress Cards
6 Victory Point Cards
140405.name: Cities and Knights Game Cards

140406.description: Basic, Seafarers, and Cities & Knights- Set 6 Players
140406.name: Wooden Viking Pieces (Basic and Expansion)

140407.description:
Catan Shop Description
The Viking edition was created for all fans of wooden game pieces. The large game pieces are modeled on buildings and ships from the Viking era. The set for the Base Game consists of 145 wooden game pieces; it also includes the pieces for 5-6 player games.
140407.name: Catan: Wooden Viking Pieces (Basic Only)

140408.description:
Catan Shop Description
The Viking edition was created for all fans of wooden game pieces. The large game pieces are modeled on buildings and ships from the Viking era. The Cities & Knights expansion consists of 101 wooden game pieces, it also includes the pieces for 5-6 player games.
140408.name: Catan: Cities & Knights – Wooden Viking Pieces

140409.description:
Catan Shop Description
The Viking edition was created for all fans of wooden game pieces. The large game pieces are modeled on buildings and ships from the Viking era. The Seafarers expansion consists of 91 wooden game pieces; it also includes the pieces for 5-6 player games.
140409.name: Catan: Seafarers – Wooden Viking Pieces

140410.name: Zippers
140410.description: Zippers is a fast paced communication quiz game. On the game cards are two sentences each, each one describing a different word. But the two sentences are, like a zipper, intertwined and at first make no sense. But if you look closely, you can possibly find out the answer. If you think you have the word, hit the reply card as soon as possible and receive the points.

140411.name: Trapdoors
140411.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the trapdoors in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Trapdoors is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Trapdoors presents:


One table providing detailed descriptions of a trapdoor’s characteristics.
One table presenting additional trapdoor features such as contents, hidden treasures, magical properties and more!
Several clever trapdoor-based traps (CRs 3-8).

140412.name: Wilderness Dressing: Hills
140412.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of glossing over the details of your PCs’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Wildernesses Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the hills in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Wilderness Dressing: Hills is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Wilderness Dressing: Hills presents:

 One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your PCs’ wilderness travel.
 One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
 One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.
 One table presenting interesting terrain features for battles and encounters.

140413.name: Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands
140413.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of glossing over the details of your PCs’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Wildernesses Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the woodlands in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands presents:


One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your PCs’ wilderness travel.
One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.
One table presenting interesting terrain features for battles and encounters.

140414.name: Wilderness Dressing: Swamps
140414.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of glossing over the details of your PCs’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Wildernesses Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the swamps in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Wilderness Dressing: Swamps is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Wilderness Dressing: Swamps presents:


One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your PCs’ wilderness travel.
One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.
One table presenting interesting terrain features for battles and encounters.

140415.name: Wilderness Dressing: Plains
140415.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of glossing over the details of your PCs’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Wildernesses Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the woodlands in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Wilderness Dressing: Plains is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Wilderness Dressing: Plains presents:


One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your PCs’ wilderness travel.
One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.
One table presenting interesting terrain features for battles and encounters.

rpgseries: QUES - Living Forgotten Realms Quest Adventures
140416.name: Liberation
140416.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Ala'Ammar is ready to lead his army from Almraiven to liberate the oppressed slaves of Calimport and Memnon. He has invited his most trusted friends and allies to join the crusade for Calimshan's liberation.

This is a Quest adventure, which means that all characters in the party must qualify to go on the quest. To participate in this adventure, each PC at the table must have at least two Story Awards from the following list: CALI10, CALI12, CALI20, CALI21, CALI23, CALI27, CALI28, and/or ADCP29.

This is a two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Calimshan for Adventure Levels 18 and 20 (these two ALs support character levels 15-20; however, the adventure was written and playtested with the assumption that no character would be below 17th level. We recommend playing with level 17-20 characters. Tables playing AL 18 with level 15/16 PCs may find this adventure extremely challenging).

It is recommended, but not required, that PCs play this adventure after having played most if not all of the previous Year 4 Paragon tier adventures set in Calimshan, including SPEC4-4 and ADCP4-2.

140418.name: Dino Daze
140418.description:
Memory Matching Mayhem

Players capture dinosaur cards by turning over a card in the battle card deck. In order to capture the dinosaur, the drawn battle card must be equal to or of a greater value than the now overturned dinosaur card.

When and if all the dinosaurs are successfully captured, the player with the greatest combined point value of all captured dinosaurs win.

140420.name: Vudila Lauamäng
140420.description:
Board game for local Estonian children game room.
Roll and move on the game board. Some special squares. Who finishes first is the winner.

140422.name: Timeout
140422.description:
Timeout is a trivia game with time pressure. Each player start with the same amount of time, and the faster you answer the faster you get to stop your clock. When running out of time you are out of the game.

When it's your turn, a trivia question is read out loud to you by an opponent and your time begins ticking. If you answer correctly, you get to stop the electronic clock, that's counting down. If you do not answer correctly (or don't answer at all) the clock counts down 20 seconds and the stops.
The questions are divided into categories. Which category you get a question from depends on a die roll. Sometime you get to choose the category for yourself or for an opponent.
If a player fails to answer correctly, the next player has the chance to answer and thereby be rewarded with 10 bonus seconds. When out of time, a player is eliminated from the game.

140423.name: Killer: Vanilla
140423.description:
Killer: Vanilla is a fast-paced card game with its tongue firmly in cheek. Players deal out death and destruction in many forms while trying to avoid the onslaught coming back at them. (This game is not recommended for children or those of a sensitive nature: bless 'em.) Kill off the weakest players to improve your hand as you balance defense and gear against a varied offense. Silent scoring heightens the tension... can you take another hit? Are Doctor De'Ath or the Booby Trap in someone's hand? Be the last man standing or take ‘em all with you!

Each turn a player may: make an Attack (Hand to Hand, Ranged, Area, Special) against any other player; play an Equipment card (aid survival); or change any or all cards in hand. Defense cards (Parry, Evade, Flee, Safe House, other) protect against Attacks, while Follow Ups boost damage. Global cards generally apply to all players. If a player gets a killing blow, his hand limit increases and he takes his target's cards. After the first kill, the scoring goes silent, leaving players with only an impression of how close to elimination they are.

Killer:Vanilla is a take-that card game which suits a 'beer & pretzels' mentality more than serious gaming. Play time is about 5 minutes per player, when you are used to the cards. The built-in expansion, The I In Team, adds some more complex solo cards as well as specific cards and rules for Team games.

140424.name: MCMLXXV
140424.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bill's Module was written for the Swords & Wizardry Kickstarter bonus goal. It is a second introductory module to Matt Finch's First Introductory Module, Grimmsgate.

"This module is intended to show how old school roleplaying provides enhanced descriptions and provides not only storyline and encounters, but creates a feeling of “being there”. I have borrowed from work I did supporting Matt Finch at North Texas RPG Con in 2011, as well as sessions I ran at PaizoCon in 2011 and 2012. Kudos to Tabletop Adventures for the great work they have put in over the years in providing table ready description text. Back in the old days, this was the way it was done—on the fly, by the old timers (and this author counts himself an “old timer”)."

1975 is meant to take you back to that time the “old-timers” talk about with a look of whistfulness in their eyes. Join us as we all travel back to 1975.

140425.name: Spire of Iron and Crystal (Swords & Wizardry)
140425.description:
From publisher blurb:

This module was written for play at GenCon 2009, as an introduction to old style free-form adventure gaming. It uses the Swords & Wizardry Core Rules. Swords & Wizardry is a "retro-clone" game, mirroring the rules of the original 1974 fantasy roleplaying game written by Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson. This original edition, which consisted of three booklets and four supplements, is often referred to as "0e." There are actually two versions of Swords & Wizardry: the WhiteBox version uses only material from the first three booklets, and the Core Rules (used here) make use of some, but by no means all, of the material from the four supplements.

Background

For centuries, out in the wilderness beyond civilization's reach, there has stood an enigmatic tower known as the Spire of Iron and Crystal. It is a bizarre and ancient structure; four massive, eggshaped crystals are mounted into a twisting, ornate structure of rounded metal girders, one crystal at the top and the other three mounted lower down. Moving lights seen inside the huge crystals suggest that they are hollow and even inhabited, but no one has ever discovered the secret of how to enter them. This is not surprising, for the tower is located on a broad stone ledge halfway up a sheer cliff face, the glassy walls of which have killed several adventurers who attempted to climb down to the tower almost a hundred feet below.

Over the course of the last few months, with considerable effort and some highly questionable methods, the adventurers have assembled quite a bit of information about the Spire - things not widely known, even among the wisest sages of the lands. Most importantly, they believe they know how to enter the structure safely. Once per year, the sun shines through an ancient runestone at the edge of the great cliff upon which the Spire stands; for a period of three days when the stars are aligned with the runestone, an invisible causeway manifests, connecting the highest crystal of the tower with the edge of the cliff, far above. According to the party's information, it is only during the first hour of evening, while the sun is visible through the runestone that the ramp remains in being.

This information promises to allow the party access to the riches of the tower, which are lavishly described in rumor and lore. They have equipped a small expedition and made their way through the trails of the wild borderlands to their goal: the tower and its still-unplundered riches.

140426.name: Dread Saecaroth  (Pathfinder)
140426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saecaroth! That most infamous den of wickedness and hatred... a tower stretching up in defiance toward the gods themselves... where the priests of the unholy Three committed acts of such evil that the gods themselves lay the tower low. Now hardly a stone stands upon a stone where the tower once brooded; the priests and minions of the Three were driven into the passages and tunnels beneath the surface where they were hunted like rats by those powerful enough to destroy them. Two centuries have passed, and the grass has grown over the site of the obscenity which once dominated the countryside. Those with wisdom may find the entrances to the dungeons underneath, and those with strength may wrest the treasures still rumored to lie in its most hidden depths, but beware! Legends whisper that some of the priests of the Three still dwell deep below... performing unspeakable rites to their alien gods and always seeking fresh and powerful sacrifices...

Now you and your comrades have learned the location and the history of this foul and forgotten place. Will you plumb its depths and bring forward the forgotten secrets and treasures that lie deep within, or will you become yet more corpses at uneasy rest in the corners of this terrible place?

An adventure for 5-8 PCs Levels 1-3.

140427.name: Dread Saecaroth  (Swords & Wizardry)
140427.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saecaroth! That most infamous den of wickedness and hatred... a tower stretching up in defiance toward the gods themselves... where the priests of the unholy Three committed acts of such evil that the gods themselves lay the tower low. Now hardly a stone stands upon a stone where the tower once brooded; the priests and minions of the Three were driven into the passages and tunnels beneath the surface where they were hunted like rats by those powerful enough to destroy them. Two centuries have passed, and the grass has grown over the site of the obscenity which once dominated the countryside. Those with wisdom may find the entrances to the dungeons underneath, and those with strength may wrest the treasures still rumored to lie in its most hidden depths, but beware! Legends whisper that some of the priests of the Three still dwell deep below... performing unspeakable rites to their alien gods and always seeking fresh and powerful sacrifices...

Now you and your comrades have learned the location and the history of this foul and forgotten place. Will you plumb its depths and bring forward the forgotten secrets and treasures that lie deep within, or will you become yet more corpses at uneasy rest in the corners of this terrible place?

An adventure for 5-8 PCs Levels 1-3.

140428.name: Scorned (Pathfinder)
140428.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs arrive in the bustling town of Whiterush and are hired to help protect a caravan from bandits. However, there is much more going on in the town than meets the eye and the PCs are in deeper than they originally thought.

For 4-6 PCs of 5th level.

140430.name: Briquid
140430.description:
Build bricks, remove them, or change the direction of gravity to get the water to the reservoir. All you need is the touch of your finger and lots of brainpower to complete all 100 fun and challenging levels!

Source: The Game Website.

140431.name: Zombicide Survivor: Helen
140431.description:
Helen was a federal agent, proud to uphold the law and protect the people. Her inquisitive nature and logical mind lead her into investigations, and she became a terror to the nation's organized crime syndicates. She finally managed to anger the wrong people, though and she was under investigation for trumped up corruption charges when the zombies came. With the streets full of flesh-eating monsters, the game had clearly changed, but Helen found that her skills and experience still applied. She finds it very refreshing not waiting for a warrant before breaking into wherever she needs to go.

Helen is an optional promotional survivor available to those that raise an extra amount on their pledge for the Zombicide Season Two Kickstarter campaign. A zombie version (Zombivor) will also be included.

140433.description: The word finder is designed with one thing in mind: scoring big points. The method is simple-present as many playable words as possible, in one place, for easy reference during the game. High-scoring words are arranged alphabetically by first letter and by inside letters, proving the widest array of possible word variations. Standard suggestions are listed in regular tpye, high-scoring words (worth 10 to 14 points) are listed in bold face, and extra high-scoring words (worth 15 points or more) are marked with an asterisk. Additional tips and resources are provided within.
140433.name: Official Scrabble Word Finder

140434.name: Trail Guides: Volume 1
140434.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Take a tour of the less-traveled Weird West with your Epitaph correspondent Phineas P. Gage for the first three Deadlands Trail Guides, now compiled into one volume for ease of reference. In Trail Guide: South o' the Border, visit beautiful Mexico. Bask in the sun as centuries-old hatred festers in the midst of a three-sided civil war. In Trail Guide: Great Northwest, you'll see the snow has its own beauty. But in this land gripped by Famine, you might give your left arm for some jerky, and that might be what it's used for! When a war between the unnatural beasts in the woods threatens to wipe humanity from the region, will your posse be up to the challenge? Finally, the Trail Guide: Weird White North takes you to the tundra of Alaska and British Columbia, a land locked in ice north of the amazing Winterline, a fence made by Hellstromme Industries to hold back the cold itself! But something more sinister, more malevolent than mere winter is being held in check...for now! Each Trail Guide offers you a closer look at the people, places, and-perhaps most important-things you'll see in each region. And don't forget the mini-Plot Point Campaigns and Savage Tales in each, as well. You're bound to have fun or die tryin'! Deadlands Trail Guides, Volume 1 is not a complete game. It's a supplement for the Deadlands Reloaded setting for the Savage Worlds game system.

140435.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In 1789, the French Revolution acted as the spark that ignited the volatile powder keg of Europe, pitching the continent into a conflagration of war and bloodshed that would last for decades. Amidst this chaos rose Napoleon Bonaparte, under whose influence France would become a dominant power, controlling, directly or indirectly, the majority of Europe. This companion for Field of Glory Napoleonic gives players all the information they need to recreate the French Revolutionary wars and the rise of Napoleon through to the campaigns of the Grande Armée and the early Empire. Emperors and Eagles also includes full army lists for the Peninsular Wars, where Britain and its Portuguese and Spanish allies slowly, but surely, turned the tide of the war and pushed Napoleon's forces back to their own borders.
140435.name: Emperors and Eagles

140436.name: Space Conspiracy!
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
140436.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Keep in mind that change is not always good and historically, revolutions rarely end well. Space Conspiracy takes role playing games into the future and then gets weird. Every new campaign spawns a host of random conspiracies to investigate and be baffled by. Scores of weapons are in the game, including lasers, slug throwers, grenades, and cabbage. Exciting vehicles such as the boring ground car are detailed in the game. Okay, so maybe that vehicle isn't that exciting, but there are a couple of tanks, and some spaceships, and a canoe. Who doesn't like canoes? Choosing from six races and six classes, players create characters that will adventure throughout the galaxy using a unique rule system that reads like it was developed by space chimps. This game masks its flaws by forcing you to roll a ridiculous number of dice and then suggests that you go out and buy more. So why haven't you gone out and bought this game already?

140437.description:
Suzerain combines elements of Deckbuilding with more traditional Trick Taking games. Throughout the game players will be playing to tricks in order to gain cards from the middle. After a trick the card gained, and the one used to gain it, will go into the player's discard pile. When a player plays their last card in hand their discard pile becomes their new hand and play continues.

Scoring is based upon sets of ranked cards as well as the Pawns and Courts which interact with certain ranked cards for bonus points.

This is a game for the Decktet; a deck with 6 suits and many double-suited cards. For more information on the decktet visit decktet.com or check out the BGG listing for Decktet.
140437.name: Suzerain

140438.name: Goblins
140438.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Creighton Broadhurst

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range of CRs for an iconic monster.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents 45 goblins (CRs 1/4-5) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140439.name: Liches
140439.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Julian Neale

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks of an iconic monster at a wide range of CRs.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents 42 liches (CRs 12-20) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140440.name: Orcs
140440.description:
Publisher Blurb

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Creighton Broadhurst

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range of CRs for an iconic monster.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents 34 orcs (CRs 1/2-7) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140441.name: Zombie Lords
140441.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Julian Neale

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range or CRs of an iconic monster.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents scores of zombie Lords (CRs 2-11) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140442.name: Skeletons
140442.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Julian Neale

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range or CRs of an iconic monster.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents 97 skeletons (CRs 1/3-8) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140443.name: Skeletal Champions
140443.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Julian Neale

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range or CRs of an iconic monster.

This instalment of 100% Crunch presents dozens of skeletal champions (CRs 2-11) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

140444.name: RetroCosmos
140444.description:
RetroCosmos is a retro arcade space invaders-like game for Android and Symbian. Protect our solar system against dozens of angry aliens. Enjoy more than 30 levels featuring 80′s graphics, vintage sound effects and techno soundtracks!

Source: The Developer Website.

140446.name: Lunnye Devitsy
140446.description:
Lunnye is a mystery/puzzle platformer. You play a little alien who falls off the moon and you have to make your way back. You must find your way back to the moon using 6 possible exits on a large mountainside full of strange locations.

You cannot die in this game; just explore, collect and solve puzzles.

Source: The Developer Website.

140447.name: Lunnye Devitsy 2013
140447.description:
User Summary

Lunnye Devitsy is described by the publisher as "a mystery/puzzle platformer." In the game, you play an alien who falls off the moon, and your goal is to get him back. The game is set on a large mountainside full of strange locations, and you have to find one of the six possible exits there to return to the moon.

The game was originally released in 2010, but the 2013 release includes widescreen support, wider controller compatibility, new locations, bug fixes, an autosave feature for when you collect new items, and other features.

140448.name: Hosford
140448.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by John Bennett

The quaint village of Hosford rests along the Cliffway of the Lonely Coast. The industrious folk of Hosford diligently work the area’s largest mine, digging deep into the cliffs for ores and gems. However, decades ago, a large section of the mine suddenly collapsed into the sea, taking a chunk of the cliffs with it along with a handful of small homes. Out of this tragedy was born opportunity as the collapse created a sheltered cove and natural harbour for small fishing boats. Thus, in addition to their mine, the citizens of Hosford ply the coastline, narrowly avoiding the sharp rocks just below the water that would doom a larger ship.

Yet, terror now grips Hosford. Folk have recently gone missing, including the former village reeve. A sea drake secretly stalks the coastline, fed on fresh human sacrifices by a senile old druid who believes the creature to be some sort of god. The fortress of Caer Syllan has dispatched a new reeve, an ambitious, inquisitive young man to look into the disappearances but so far all he has uncovered are old grudges as neighbour accuse neighbour of these recent crimes.

Hosford is compatible with the Lonely Coast campaign setting, but is also easily inserted into any GM’s home campaign.

140449.name: White Moon Cove (Pathfinder)
140449.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Marc Radle

White Moon Cove is a respectable fishing town located in a cove which acts as an excellent, natural harbour. The inhabitants of this tightly-knit community are sober, hardworking and amiable fishermen, traders and other sturdy folk making their living from the sea.

Despite being a fairly peaceful and law-abiding place, White Moon Cove still hold many opportunities for adventure, from rumours of secret smuggler activity to an ancient and possibly haunted lighthouse. Yet, perhaps the most famous reason for White Moon Cove's notoriety is the mysterious underwater edifice known as the Sunken Pyramid which lies hidden far beneath the waves a few miles out to sea. The handful of sages and scholars possessing any knowledge of this massive stone structure debate whether it is a completely natural rock formation, a natural site that has somehow been intentionally modified, or something built long ago by human, or inhuman, hands.

140450.description: In the game of Dragon Caster, you take on the role of a powerful sorcerer who fights other Casters for glory and conquest. Your casting numbers represent either the dragons you can summon to battle, or the type of mana that your dragons may obtain. This mana can be used to grant your dragons a variety of special powers. In order to gain victory, you must destroy the area containing your opponent's Caster.
140450.name: Dragon Caster

140451.description:
Command Expansion #1 comes with nine cards, numbered 1 to 9.

During setup, each player randomly takes one Command card. Command cards give player a unique ability for the entire game or once per round.

Examples:

(1) Scavenger. When refilling your hand from the draw pile, you may claim one of them from the top of a discard pile instead. The card may not be a wild card from the Trash pile.

(2) Rapid Advance. You can create 1-3 sets per turn.
boardgameversion: Sunrise Tornado Game Studio English Edition
140451.name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Command Expansion #1

140452.description:
Command Expansion #2 comes with nine cards, numbered 10 to 18.

During setup, each player randomly takes one Command card. Command cards give player a unique ability for the entire game or once per round.

Examples:

(10) Summon East Winds. Once per round, you may create a set from any one card in the discard pile. This must be performed on your own turn.

(11) Hard of Heart. After you draw 1 card at the beginning of the turn, you may discard 2 Beauty cards and draw three new cards or discard 3 Beauty cards and draw five new cards.
boardgameversion: Sunrise Tornado Game Studio English Edition
140452.name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Command Expansion #2

140453.description:
The Allegiance Expansion comes with nine cards in three allegiance colors.

During setup, each player takes an Allegiance card of his/her team. When the round ends, Allegiance cards count as a card in the color set it matches.
boardgameversion: Sunrise Tornado Game Studio Kickstarter Edition
140453.name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Allegiance Expansion

140454.description: Earth Element is an event card. When it is drawn, active draws a card then place it on the side face up. When the round ends, all players may use it as an additional score card to score. Remove from the game after scoring.
boardgameversion: Sunrise Tornado Game Studio Essen Promo 2013
140454.name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: 2013 Essen Promo – Earth Element

140455.description:
This game was inspired from the game villages created by Jaron Frost.

Players play cards in groups of 3 cards to create levels, and may add more later on. Each card has a coin values. The first player who reaches 100 coins wins the game. Each turn players may attack a level of a player with one of their units to steal one of their cards. Each unit have a special ability that may affect their values during the game.

Cards are in French and English
140455.name: 8Bit Flashback: Super Mario Bros 3

140457.description:
A terrible thing is happening in a local village: Werewolves are responsible for the deaths of many villagers. Unable to determine who amongst themselves are werewolves, they've called in a group of master inquisitors to help sort out this mess before it's too late. That's where you and your team come in. No stranger to werewolf infestations, you know that the best thing to do is to start lynching suspects.

You no sooner get started on this project when you discover that there's a problem – Werewolves have also infiltrated your team of inquisitors! Now you're in a serious pickle: You need to save the village while thwarting the werewolves whom are working alongside you...

Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition is a standalone game of deduction, secrets and betrayal with no elimination. Part of the fun is figuring out who the werewolves are on your team, but even then, you've still got to outsmart them!

More specifically, the humans need to rid the town of werewolves in order to win, while the werewolf players need to eliminate human villagers so that the werewolves can overrun the town. To do this, each round players either use the power of a villager's hut or take two votes from the supply. Each player then places one vote on a resident, and the resident with the most votes against him is lynched, with him and his hut being taken out of play. The werewolf players then secretly choose to kill a resident – but only one of those chosen by the Grand Inquisitor, a role that passes hands each round. Who will live? Who will die? It's in your hands...
140457.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 356 - La Boca and Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition
Garrett's Games 371 - Ted and Toni Alspach talk Bezier Games
Sweet Strats Episode 1: Resistance, Werewolf the Inquisition, Skull and Roses and Coup

140458.name: Hit fast! Hit hard!
140458.description:
As the eastern bloc crumbles in 1989 Gorbatjov is ousted in a reactionary coup led by the Soviet military. In desperate attempt to turn back time and unite the eastern bloc the long prepared offensive into western Europe is launched. A critical element for success is to be able to interdict the American reinforcements over the Atlantic to its NATO allies. That job belongs to the submarines of the arctic fleet in Murmansk. But they need air support and support from surface vessels as well and Murmansk is too far away from the North Atlantic seas to provide that support. In order to seize air fields and naval bases on the Norwegian west coast as fast as possible an invasion of Finland and Sweden is launched at the same time as the Norwegian border is crossed on the Nordkapp to outflank the Norwegian easily defensible terrain along the northern coast. Neutrality will not protect Sweden this time. But maybe an army of 600 000 trained men and 600 tanks will?
This game deals with the southern part of the Soviet operation against Sweden, the invasion of Skåne. The well trained paratroopers of the VDV and the equally well trained Baltic marines land to face the bulk of the Swedish armoured brigades supported by infantry and artillery in terrain ideally suited for armoured units. Will the Swedish built turret less tank Strv 103 meet the expectations, though twenty years in service now, or will it be up to the British built Centurions, with more than thirty years in service, to destroy the invaders?
With X pages of rules, XXX counters X maps and 13 scenarios the game is designed to help understanding of the challenges of the Swedes as well as those of the Warpac. While gameplay is designed to be fast and easy with command and control issues being in the centre of the design the optional rules allow for deeper study into logistics and recovery. Units are platoons and each game turn equals one hour . Hexes are 500 meters across.

Hit fast! Hit hard! centres on the 7th armoured brigade, PB7 Malmöbrigaden, and its hypothetical but well planned and trained actions around Ystad on the Scanian south coast. Equipped with Strv 103C, the upgraded version of the famous “S” tank was the cutting edge of the XI. Division responsible for repelling or at least fixing an invasion aimed at Ystad or Trelleborg. While PB7 might be superior in fire power to the air assault and naval infantry units it initially will encounter these are the elite units of the Soviet union. If the soviets seize a working harbour mechanised units with T-72M1 tanks are sure to pour in fast. You will also see parts of two different Swedish types of infantry brigades as well as territorial defence units and the 12th independent mechanised battalion with Strv 102R, partly upgraded Centurions, and motorised rifle companies in trucks rather than Pbv 302 infantry fighting vehicles.

140460.name: CORPS Rules Expansion
140460.description:
designer blurb

New rules and Bestiary for the CORPS (2nd Edition) ruleset by BTRC (Blacksburg Tactical Research Center)

140462.name: Un Contre Tous
boardgameversion: Jouets Éducatifs Universels French first edition
140462.description:
"One against All" in English is a word game in which a player, in turn, plays against all others.

One player has 6 minutes to choose three secret words (maximum 10 letters per word), and gives a definition for these three words. The player draws half of the letter-cards for his opponents and gives information how many number of times this letter is present in the words etc. Player keeos other half of the cards.

When all the cards are drawn, the opponents have 6 minutes to find the words. For this, they can ask questions related to words, the player can only answer yes or no. Opponents can also ask if the letters kept by him during the draw are part of words.
The player receives tokens for each question or request letters, and receives a bonus for word not found.
The game is played over several rounds. The final winner is the one who has the most points.

140463.name: Back to the Dungeon (Vol 1,  Issue 1 - Mar 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Regional Map of Raven's Keep Area
Rolling up a Character for The Little Barony and House Rules
The Ancient Ways of the Grain Goddess
What is the Raven's Keep Adventuring Society?
140463.description: An old school zine dedicated to describing The Little Barony and the megadungeon therein.
