140464.name: Back to the Dungeon (Vol 1,  Issue 2 - Mar 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Additional Hooks, Quest, Descriptions, and Stories
Notes on Elves and Halflings for AEC
The Claim by Raven's Keep Adventuring Society
140464.description: An issue devoted to describing The Little Barony and the megadungeon therein.

140465.name: Perfidious
140465.description:
PERFIDIOUS is a two player war game, set on a small map where two factions battle for control of the other’s Home Hex. All the armies in the game have their true strength hidden and battles are won based on the claims of the players (but the players can lie to win).

Players must use deceit to outwit their opponent and only by hiding your strengths and weaknesses will they succeed. But be careful; your opponent can call your bluffs and in doing so, may unravel your plans completely!

The base rules are simple and easy to learn but the game can be modified by a collection of optional rules to be mixed and matched at the start of the game by the players.

This game is also completely free to play and can be printed with any standard printer using 8½x11 paper. Some components require cutting so scissors are required for the initial building of the game.

This game is released under the Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported

140466.name: CiRKiTRY
140466.description:
In CiRKiTRY, players have been invited to a local electronics competition. Your goal is to create a electronic circuit that uses all 5 of the following components: a Battery, a Resistor, an Inductor, a Capacitor, and an LED bulb. However, to make things more difficult, everyone will be competing on the same circuit board.

Players take turns uncovering circuit board tiles and placing their electronic components along the conductive paths. But be careful! The Voltage on the Volt-a-Meter fluctuates as components are played. If the Voltage gets raised too high, you might cause a destructive power surge.

Use Solder pieces to create pathways and make new connections. Not all 5 of the electronic components need to be your own, and you can attempt to piggyback off of your opponents' placement.

CiRKiTRY does not require prior knowledge of electronic engineering to play.

140467.description:
They came for our resources…
They came to annihilate us…
They came for our… cows?!

Welcome to Mars vs Earth! In this alternate-reality, 1950’s era setting – we are not alone! Aliens from the planet Mars have secretly descended upon Earth. As a member of an elite multi-national squad, you must defend our home against the vicious, little green men as they try to abduct our wives, mutilate our cows and boil our oceans!

To complicate matters (as if inside-out cows weren't bad enough), the aliens can replicate our DNA and clone human beings. They know our agency is the last line of defense and they have infiltrated our ranks. That trusted partner of yours may actually be an alien spy! Hey, I don’t remember you holding your hand over your heart during the National Anthem – when was the last time your DNA was screened?

About the game:

Mars vs. Earth is a simple card game, playable by 3 to 10 players in 30 to 60 minutes, that employs a modified "hidden loyalty" system. Mars vs. Earth introduces new mechanics, such as scaled martian powers and an accusation/trial system, that sit atop a wacky theme to increase play value and enjoyment.

Think your neighbor is secretly working against the agency? Keep him from leading missions, or better yet make a formal accusation and bring him to trial for his evil deeds! Of course you need to be careful - if you accidentally oust a true human from the agency they will become a lowly citizen with far fewer powers to help combat the martian threats!

The game is over when either the humans have foiled enough of the martians' plans or the martians have destroyed every last human resource, be it military defenses, tech, people or food. In either case, Mars vs. Earth is guaranteed to create some of the greatest play experiences imaginable!
140467.name: Mars vs. Earth

140468.description:
All your life all you've wanted was to have the best, the biggest, and the most awesome tick collection in the world. With You Suck, that dream is close to becoming a reality.

Using a suited deck, you and your opponents will play cards onto seven different ticks, each with a unique power. Take advantage of these powers to ensure that you'll match your bid and capture even more ticks. You'll score points for bidding correctly and for capturing special bonus point ticks!

That's right – it's a tick-taking game, a close cousin of "trick-taking" games, but oh-so-much better because it has cute ticks. And it's more fun.
140468.name: You Suck
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 355 - You Suck, Tzolkin, Bora Bora, Ground Floor
Garrett's Games 371 - Ted and Toni Alspach talk Bezier Games

140469.description:
KiCKeT is a football simulation game based on tactical movement of miniatures. The game is played with the feet: miniatures movement, passes and shots on goal, goalkeeper defence are all performed with one foot.

The game is about to get published and several versions of the box are envisaged. The boxes only differ in terms of amount of components, i.e. the number miniatures and the addition or not of various accessories.

“Standard" components:
- 2 or 4 wooden miniature field players, 20 cm high
- 2 wooden miniature goalkeepers, 20 cm high
- 2 goals of adjustable size
- 1 small fake-leather ball, soft inflated (no risk of damage…)
- markers for field and goal area corners

The game is playable on many surfaces: grass, carpet, parquet floor (with the “socks” accessory), cement, even sand !

The number of miniatures should be adapted to the field size, e.g. 2x3 m with 2 field players and a goalkeeper, 4x6 m with 4 field players and a goalkeeper.

As for human players, they can of course play 1-on-1, but playing 2-on-2 works perfectly, and with more players also assuming more miniatures (and space) are available. An atmosphere of table football played with the feet, or of giant, say, 8-players football table.

Basic rules:
- players take turns, and have 2 actions per turn
- possible actions are: move a miniature, or play the ball; the ball can be played directly with the foot, or a miniature can be pushed such that it moves the ball
- to be allowed to kick the ball, it must first be under control: a miniature controls the ball if one foot cannot be inserted between the miniature and the ball
- a shot on goal can be taken at any time, if the ball is under control; the intention to shoot must be announced
- the opponent can defend his goal with one foot; his other foot must stay planted behind the goal
- any contact with another miniature is a foul, which ends the turn

Other simple and logical rules take care of particular circumstances, in order to keep the flow of the game going.
140469.name: KiCKeT!

140470.description: A set of pink player pieces for Gemblo.
140470.name: Gemblo: Pink Player Set

140471.description: A set of orange player pieces for Gemblo.
140471.name: Gemblo: Orange Player Set

140472.name: Fluidity: Spin Cycle
140472.description:
Tilt, turn, and rotate your Nintendo 3DS system 360 degrees to move a puddle of water through a maze-like, magical world. Change between liquid, ice, or steam to solve fun, gravity-defying puzzles and defeat Goop monsters. It features an all-new storybook setting that spans the ages—from a world of dinosaurs to the modern age and beyond.

Source: The Game Website.

140473.name: Texas Hold'em
140473.description:
User Summary

Both a poker teaching tool and actual game.

140474.name: Tak 2: Staff of Dreams (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
140474.description:
Back of the box

Troubled with strange dreams, Tak can feel a dark juju emanating from an unfamiliar world. Equipped with new powers Tak bravely ventures outside the pupanunu tree and discovers and evil behind his wildest dreams.

Command the power of animals to solve puzzles

140477.name: Kyro 5
140477.description:
Defeat your Pharaoh foe by being the first to place five pyramids in a row.

Game includes 24 plastic pyramids - 12 green and 12 blue. Players take turns placing a pyramid on the table. Pyramids must touch when they are placed. First player to get 5 in a row wins!

140478.name: Меценат
140478.description:
Simple auction card game. Players have a money cards from 10 to 150 dollar bids, and two special cards "Sheikh" and "Forgery". They bid on paintings, the paintings bring victory points (4 to 15) and have a frame of color, if you collect three pictures of the same frame, yout get another 5 points. Forgery of "fake"

Gameplay is a blind auction. After considerm players scoring points for the picture and points beyond.

Theme of the game: the auction of paintings XIX - XX centuries.

140479.name: Купи Слона
140479.description: "Kupi Slona" - translates "Do You Want to Buy an Elephant?". It is a version of a climbing game (a famous game mechanics).

140480.name: Pyramid
140480.description:
User Summary
Pyramid is a solitaire card game using a traditional deck of cards (no Jokers). 28 cards are arranged in a pyramid with cards below covering half of a card in a row above. The bottom row will consist of 7 cards, with the peak consisting of a single card.

The player works to remove all cards from the pyramid by making sets of two cards that add up to 13. Aces are worth 1, Jacks are 11, Queens 12, and Kings 13 (and can be removed individually).

The remaining cards make up the Stock, or draw pile, and can be used to make sets.

The game is over if no more sets can be removed from the board, and a score is given by the value of cards left in the pyramid. Thus, a perfect score is 0.

140481.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 1 - Apr 2012)
140481.description: THE fanzine of old school weirdness.

140482.name: TRIBES Anthology III
140482.description:
Publisher Blurb

TRIBES: Anthology III presents the following tribes:

 Bugbears of the Frozen Tears: Lurking in the White Cliffs, the Bugbears of the Frozen Tears revel in terrifying their foes to death.

 Cultists of Havra Zhoul: Law-obsessed cultists who follow the teachings of the ghostly once-paladin, Havra Zhoul.

 Duergar of the Obsidian Citadel: Debased and cruel crafters of cursed magic items.

 Frost Giant Pirates of the Icy Heart: Frost giant pirates and the white dragon Flashfreeze sail their enchanted iceberg-ship in search of plunder!

 Orcs of the Eternal Zenith: Worshippers of the violent, burning aspect of the sun, these orcs spread their beliefs with brutal, missionary zeal.

140483.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 2 - Aug 2012)
140483.description: THE fanzine for old school weirdness!

140484.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 3 - Oct 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Beneath the Ruins Part 3: Caves of the Arachnomancer & The Blasphemous Halls
140484.description: THE fanzine of old school weirdness!

140485.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 4 - Feb 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Beneath the Ruins Part 4: The Great Cavern
140485.description:
From the marketing blurb:

Yay! Through much turmoil, shouting and cursing, I have wrested from my laptop's clutching electronic fingers yet another mind-exploding issue of Wizards Mutants Laser Pistols! This issue is full of fun stuff, supplied once again by the WMLP crew...John?, Bob Richens, myself, and our intrepid cover artist Dr. Brainus Manginus. We hope you enjoy this new offering.

140486.name: The Shattered Empire (Swords & Wizardry)
140486.description:
From publisher blurb:

For millennia the men of the north were pitted against one another in ceaseless battle, one city-state against another. In due time, the men of Yal-Garok gained the upper hand, dominating the minor city-states through arranged marriages and then striking at its greatest rivals militarily and forcing them to sue for peace. The rise of Yal-Garok ushered in the Age of Peace, allowing the clever, hard-working Northmen to focus their energies are building rather than destroying one another. Most of the country was brought under cultivation, towns and cities flourished and colonies were established in the eastern mountains, the western prairie and, unsuccessfully, the icy woodlands of the far north.

140487.name: The Shattered Empire (Pathfinder)
140487.description:
From publisher blurb:

For millennia the men of the north were pitted against one another in ceaseless battle, one city-state against another. In due time, the men of Yal-Garok gained the upper hand, dominating the minor city-states through arranged marriages and then striking at its greatest rivals militarily and forcing them to sue for peace. The rise of Yal-Garok ushered in the Age of Peace, allowing the clever, hard-working Northmen to focus their energies are building rather than destroying one another. Most of the country was brought under cultivation, towns and cities flourished and colonies were established in the eastern mountains, the western prairie and, unsuccessfully, the icy woodlands of the far north.

140488.name: The Pirate Coast (Pathfinder)
140488.description:
From publisher blurb:

In ancient times the Pirate Coast was home to a great civilization of stone giants. The stone giants maintained a wide-reaching kingdom of towns and villages. Despite their great size and power they relied on slaves taken from the primitive human tribes of the coast. In time, the stone giants grew lazy and decadent, and when humanoids poured into the coastal lands and gradually destroyed the stone giant kingdom. The stone giants were more powerful than the humanoids, but they were more numerous and they outbred the giants. Worse yet, the stone giants found themselves plagued by slave revolts. The humans of the coast founded their own kingdom on the island to the east of the coast and came to be called the Bucranians by the bull skulls they used as standards. More than a century ago, the roving pirates of the White Island discovered the wealth of the Bucranians and began raiding their villages and towns. When the White Islands sank, many settled along the Pirate Coast and started making deeper and deeper raids into Bucrania, burning villages and carting away slaves from the old and lethargic kingdom.

140489.name: The Pirate Coast (Swords & Wizardry)
140489.description:
From publisher blurb:

In ancient times the Pirate Coast was home to a great civilization of stone giants. The stone giants maintained a wide-reaching kingdom of towns and villages. Despite their great size and power they relied on slaves taken from the primitive human tribes of the coast. In time, the stone giants grew lazy and decadent, and when humanoids poured into the coastal lands and gradually destroyed the stone giant kingdom. The stone giants were more powerful than the humanoids, but they were more numerous and they outbred the giants. Worse yet, the stone giants found themselves plagued by slave revolts. When the White Islands sank, many settled along the Pirate Coast and started making deeper and deeper raids into Bucrania, burning villages and carting away slaves from the old and lethargic kingdom.

140490.name: Shattered Empires
140490.description:
Join the galactic conflict by taking control of one of five factions in this customizable card game. Pick your strategy. You can choose to the Empire, those forces still united in uneasy alliance, or side with the rogue element, Warlord Darkon, and his stolen Imperial Technology. Become a member of the Bogathan Empire, hell-bent on making up for those centuries of denial and finally eradicating all the inferior life forms. Maybe you’ll join with the Merchant Coterie, banding up with other freighter captains, merchants, and mercenaries, while trying to fulfill your Black Market deals. Become a part of the Void, sentient battle computers that want nothing more than to continue to repair and expand, even at the expense of everything else in the galaxy.

Shattered Empires is an expandable card game where each player has their own customized deck of cards built around a chosen faction. Each deck contains a Base, which represents the player, then all the components necessary to build a fleet of ships and wage war in an effort to destroy all opposing bases.

Players take turns allocating their resources, building ships, acquiring more resources, then using those ships and resources to attack their opponents.

140491.name: The Troll Hills (Swords & Wizardry)
140491.description:
From publisher blurb:

Next to a little rock formation on the Great River generations of adventurers and the folk who serve them have established an outpost on the verge of the Troll Hills. Hidden in those rocky promontories are every breed of troll known to man and giants besides, remnants of the creation of the world with a mind to keep their secrets and their treasures to themselves. Screw up your courage and make a foray against the big folk!

140492.name: The Troll Hills (Pathfinder)
140492.description:
From publisher blurb:

Next to a little rock formation on the Great River generations of adventurers and the folk who serve them have established an outpost on the verge of the Troll Hills. Hidden in those rocky promontories are every breed of troll known to man and giants besides, remnants of the creation of the world with a mind to keep their secrets and their treasures to themselves. Screw up your courage and make a foray against the big folk!

140493.name: Ultramodern4
140493.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mission of U4 is to present 4th EDITION D&D rules for use in non-fantasy settings. These include pre-modern settings, contemporary settings, and those that are far flung fantastic and futuristic. U4 is perfectly suited for any of these following campaigns:

Cyberpunk
Espionage
Modern warfare
Space opera
Technofantasy
Urban fantasy
Wild west, with or without aliens




U4 has no included setting, allowing you to explore the rules in whatever context you wish. The rules are offered in a general way, not assuming any time period. The equipment lists a wide range of various firearms. Though most are modern, there are quite a few that are retro and futuristic.

Features:

The new "Ladder" system which offers more adjustability with character creation. Modify your class with one of seven ladders.
Eleven new classes including sniper, faceman, infiltrator, and the grappler.
New armor including powered combat suits.
New skills & feats.
All new weapons including traditional firearms, rocket launchers, and laser rifles.
Pimp your auto. Purchase vehicles and modify their features.
All new opponents from fanatics to tanks.




user comment
The difference in version page count appears to be one of font size and formatting; the OGL version uses a MUCH larger font, but all the info appears to be the same.

140494.name: Gadget Guide: Archaic Weapons
140494.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Archaic Weapons

Even in the modern world of superheroes, archaic weapons like swords, hammers, and bows remain common. Some of these weapons are enhanced by magic or technological gadgetry, while others rely solely on the tremendous skill of their wielders. In either case, old school weapons are primary tools for many heroes and villains and this Gadget Guide looks at them in detail.

140495.name: Wake
140495.description:
Wake is the story of an engineer trapped on a sinking ship. Navigate through the ship and find his way to the surface above.

- Dodge bullets, fire, electricty - but most of all avoid drowning!
- Collect keys, torches and other items to stay alive!

Source: The Developer Website.

140496.name: Trizzle
140496.description:
Trizzle is a equilateral triangle-shaped tiles sliding puzzle game. How fast can you put the tiles in order? Free play and Challenge modes. You can choose pictures from gallery included in the game, your photo albums or photo taken by the camera. OpenFeint powered LeaderBoards and Achievements, compare your times and number of moves with the others from around the world or your friends.

Source: The Developer Website.

140497.name: After the War (2011)
140497.description:
From booklet (translated from italian)

Year 2049,the planet has been ravaged by a Nuclear war Between Usa and China.Only a small region in the ancient Russia remains,between rubble,survivors of the Great War,go on with the hope to rise from the ashes....
Joined in clans they fight for control of the small resources remaining between rubble of the old human civilization.But soon they'll uncover a new enemy who'll force them to join forces...or to disappear forever.

140498.name: Reclamation
140498.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reclamation is a post-apocalyptic RPG that combines sci-fi, fantasy and survival horror themes with a unique card-based game system. The earth as we knew it is dead. A global pandemic called The Sickness brought an end to the modern age by transforming much of the human race into a mob of bloodthirsty degenerates. Those who succumbed to the disease were driven mad with the desire to fulfill their darkest and most violent fantasies. The leaders of the once-free world (also driven mad by The Sickness) armed themselves with nuclear vengeance and set our world to flame. From the burnt ashes of earth, the Dystopia was born. It's a land torn apart by radiation and stitched back together with a thread of the supernatural.

In Reclamation, you play survivors of the Nuclear Cataclysm who've gained special powers from the fallout: sorcery, nano-technology, mutations, etc. You must fight to survive the horrors of the Dystopia while “reclaiming” the lost glory of the elder civilization.

140499.name: Move the Eggs
140499.description:
User Summary

In Move the Eggs, a chicken needs you to send her eggs tumbling (gently) down the level into a padded nest in each level. The player has a host of materials that can be arranged to soften the fall of the egg and guide it to the nest, including rotatable platforms, feathers, and so on.

140500.name: Happy Feet Two: Slippery Slopes Game
140500.description: In Slippery Slopes, players attempt to be the first to move his or her penguin to the end space. After rolling a die, a player moves his or her token to the next space matching the color or design on the die. When landing on a Happy Feet space, the token slides down a snow hill and lands in a new space.
